Reviews.Title: “Memories”
Reviews.Author: billhambor
Reviews.Content: We took our kids here just about every summer while we lived in Florida . It's a great place for family. We hadn't been there in almost 17 years, our childeren now 25 and 29. But my son and his family now make a yearly trip there as they live in Florida. We moved to North Carolina but met up with my son & family for labor day weekend there. Except for a few changes it was just as we remembered it. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, the pools and slide we enjoyed as we had in the past. We could view the ocean from our balcony and watch the sunrise each morning. Took walks on the beach and ate at some very nice restuarants. We all enjoyed our time together and at the Sun Viking Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, dated, but kids never care about that!”
Reviews.Author: rtsmudbug
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Rooms & appliances are dated but for the price its a good deal. Staff were all great & were vigilant to make sure only hotel guests were on the property. Great beach access & beach. Due to the age of property it wasnt surprising that the slide & elevator broke down during our stay. Would stay again with family. Not the place for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Think Motel, not Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mordrydd
Reviews.Content: I was on a road trip around Florida with my son. We deliberately didn't book any accommodation in advance, waiting to see where we would end up, and subsequently booking overnight stays at the last minute via hotels.com. Once we realised we were going to be in Daytona we surfed all the late deals we could get. There were all manner of deals available, with all the usual Marriott's etc making good offers, but the high regard in which the Sun Viking Lodge is held on Tripadvisor led me to book this independent accommodation. Hotels.com managed to fleece me by allowing me to book an upgraded "Ocean View" room, but they failed to arrange this with the hotel, who resolutely put us into a room with a view of the car park. Now I quite accept that the error here is hotels.com, not Sun Viking Lodge. However I was hugely disappointed that the desk staff, even when I showed my booking confirmation email with evidence of my having booked an Ocean View room, refused to rearrange my room. While they were brilliant at getting hold of numbers with which to try to contact hotels.com customer service, the repeated insistence that the mistake was nothing to do with them actually became insulting and irritating. You'd have almost believed that they weren't getting any money from my booking, which of course is just not the case. Having spent ages trying (and failing) to get hold of hotels.com, and having been abandoned at the desk by the check-in staff, I decided that life was too short and that I just wanted to get into my room, any room. So I gave in. When I read of other guests having problems and being helped so genuinely, I do feel aggrieved that I was effectively abandoned by the staff. I try to be fair and measured in my reviews, and I certainly don't hold Sun Viking Lodge responsible for the error in my booking. But I do feel their customer service in failing to help me out when I was clearly upset fell below what I would expect, especially from an establishment with a Tripadvisor award The room was clean, smelling strongly of disinfectant, with a large bedroom area, a rather dated, non flat screen TV, a dated kitchen aea and old school tiny bathroom. It was a motel room, not a hotel room, and as such was fine. But as one of seven comparably priced rooms I booked back to back over as many days it was the least impressive by some distance. I write this review in a Radisson in Orlando which cost almost to the dollar the same as the Sun Viking last night, but feels in a different league in terms of quality. So how does this hotel get such great reviews. Or alternatively, why is my review so crabby compared to so many others? The answer must lie in expectations, I suppose. This is a resort motel, with loads going on, many things for which you'd be paying extra to keep the kids entertained. As such it represents excellent value, and the staff are a credit to the owner. So my message is to take my review with a pinch of salt if the myriad extras are important to you. But if you're looking for a quality roof over your head for a night or two, you might feel, as I do, that your money is better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time at a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sun Viking Lodge while I was in Daytona attending to family business and for a small vacation. We stayed Fri-Thur I first stayed at the Sun Viking when I was a wee lad about 18 years ago and multiple times over the past decade and it still has the same amazing atmosphere. The staff is wonderful and work to make sure your staff is amazing. (huge shout out to Greg). The hotel is extremely clean and kept up (Efficiency stove shows it's age, but a minor thing). Beds are comfy too! The Kafe is a great value with good food so you don't have to leave to get lunch or breakfast if you don't want to. As most will say, weekends are usually full with lots of families, but it settled down over the weekdays. Can't say enough about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: daddyschamp
Reviews.Content: Another great vacation spent at the Sun Viking Lodge. As the kids get older and can roam about by themselves to the activities, it is even better. The place is safe and the people are great. Pool and waterslide never get old. There is always a staff member close by to help with what ever is needed. We stay Sun-Fri to avoid the weekends which seem to be a little more crowded. The beach was perfect this year. The water was surprisingly very chilly, but refreshing and crystal clear. There are so many places on Daytona beach and they all look great from the outside, but really we have no reason to book anywhere else and take a risk at having a bad experience. The new beds and linens and carpeting in the rooms was a nice welcoming addition as we walked in. One negative was the kitchen in our ocean front efficiency. The stove was very old and needs to be replaced. We actually had the same room this year as last year and remembered that problem. We grill most of the dinners, but the few times we used the stove was a challenge, but we made do. Can't wait until next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun for kids!”
Reviews.Author: realtybytes
Reviews.Content: Just visited the Sun Viking Lodge for the first time with my daughter and her 4 children. I was quite pleased with the helpfulness of the staff and their wonderful attitudes toward the children. Every staff person we encountered was very helpful and friendly. The kids absolutely LOVED the outdoor pool and slide......and boy did they sleep well at night! We had a minor medical situation while there and the manager on duty, Greg, was very attentive and handled the situation with professionalism. We were only there 2 nights but we can't wait to go back. Already starting to plan the next trip there. Just a few words of advice......this is a place that caters to families .....if you prefer not to be around children try another motel. I would not want to book a room here expecting a quiet time around the pool.........But it was exactly what we were looking for with the 4 children. Sharon

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Trevor E
Reviews.Content: Another vacation has come and gone. We are sad to say goodbye to the friendly staff but are eager to be back next year. All new beds, carpets, couches, and curtains show the management cares. Its nice to see a business upgrading in this tough economy. Clean rooms as always. Our family loves it here. The atmosphere is unmatched. Thank you to all the staff and management for another great stay with my family. Highly recommended to families!

Reviews.Title: “If you have children, you don't want to miss this one!”
Reviews.Author: Philip D
Reviews.Content: While in Daytona for many Bike events we repeatedly stay at "SUN VIKING LODGE", the main reason, is because of the location of this marvelous Hotel and its pristine beach and accomodations. Now don't get me wrong this is no 5 star resort, but it is however very nice and clean for the money. It's best if you call ahead and reserve the beach view rooms, prefferably top floors for noise reduction. The reason I say this is a great place to stay with children, is the POOLS, they have a wonder pool with a huge slide outside, and they also have a very nice indoor pool incase the weather turns a little ruff. They also have rooms you walk right out to the pool on the first floor, oh ya the best part they have a "HOT TUB< small but fun none the less. Daytona Beach Pier is a short walk north from the hotel , or you can drive it, the wife and I preffer to drive as walking is a little ruff for me. The property fronts beautiful sun drenched "DAYTONA BEACH". You can get food right there at the hotel at their Tiki bar and grill, otherwise there is many resturants all with in walking distance. As I said before we go there every year for "Bike Week" and "Biketoberfest", for those events we make reservations well in advance, as they pack up quick, during those events the staff provide , clean roped off parking for the bikes which is "Security" watched by the way, "BIG PLUS" and the hotel also provides "Wipe Down Rags" and collections buckets which is very, very thoughful, they go completely out of their way there to make us all feel very welcomed and this is why this gets our top vote for the best place to stay in Daytona for the money. $$$< Moderately Priced, extended satys welcomed

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahpoo
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel I stay at when I vacation at Daytona beach it has a slide for the kids a tiling bar for lunch and is just the right distance from the action at the boardwalk.defisntlybcheck this hotel out if you plan on going to Daytona beach

Reviews.Title: “great best hotel for kids and parents”
Reviews.Author: lena b
Reviews.Content: the hotel is the best for kids and parents my kids loved the pool and the slide more then the beach. my husband and i loved sitting on the balony and watching the waves at night the room was very good full kitchen . i loved our stay loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around....still great!”
Reviews.Author: binski
Reviews.Content: Stayed at SV back in 2010 but it took me this long to get back. This time, it was me (the mom) and 4 teenagers! And boy did we have a blast. Kids agenda every day: pool, indoor pool, beach, hot tub, basketball court, repeat 100 times a day! It was so nice for me to just be able to kick back with a book and let the kids roam. And they found about 5 other kids to hang with as well. I have now promised my two and the two neighbor kids I brought that this will be a tradition. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deniseallencan
Reviews.Content: My parents are rather picky about where they will stay. This hotel was exactly what they were looking for. Easy access from the car to their room. The room was large and very nice. The beds were new and comfortable. We could not have been happier!! The staff here makes all the differerence. Very caring.

Reviews.Title: “The best place ever for families”
Reviews.Author: upset64
Reviews.Content: Been coming here for many years!!! No complaints. All around great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time”
Reviews.Author: frank m
Reviews.Content: Members of our extended family have stayed here before, but it was our first time. The staff was wonderful, from front desk to maintenance. Rooms were clean. The property isn't as fancy or expensive as other resorts we have stayed in Daytona, but it was just as good. The only problem we had was the elevator had some trouble, but it was minor.

Reviews.Title: “Same place as last time.”
Reviews.Author: Shangri_la_Seeker
Reviews.Content: Great family place. Only wish Daytona Beach Shores would open some fast food places. Kids like hamburgers and chicken strips and going to "OCEAN WALK" is expensive and over priced. The fast food places there are inconvient. Sun Viking could leave their KAFE open later than 2pm and sale those items.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kingsoftravel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another great stay @ Sun Viking Lodge and had a wonderful time. The kids enjoyed the activities-Brandi always does a fantastic job :) Love the new carpet in the room. Staff was very helpful & went out of their way to help us a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: kleiman63
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and nice. The staff was very pleasant. The rooms were great for the price. The only thing we could suggest is a coffee pot in the room. My husband paid for coffee at the cafe a $1.00 a cup. No one told us there was free coffee at the office. Other than that great place would go back

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: missyopd
Reviews.Content: We had a surprise party for my sister at Sun Viking and they were great. The facilities were clean and in working order. The rooms were spotless. The front desk was very accomadating when we needed a ground floor room for a friend in a wheelchair. The slide and the pool area is awesome. lots of room and fun things going on most of the day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There are tons of stuff for the kids to do: playground, indoor and outdoor pool, and volley ball on the beach and a basketball hoop. Shuffle board was fun and the cafe was convenient. We will be back!!! Thanks Sun Viking for making my sister's 40th party the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool areas”
Reviews.Author: LynnetteB
Reviews.Content: We used to come here when my kids are little until my son said that there were only '5 year olds' there. My daughter just got a job in Florida so we went back since the drug testing facilities was pretty close to Sun Viking. In May, it was pretty empty. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub and a long walk on the beach. They say it is one of the cleanest but I noticed when I was lying in bed that the ceiling fan badly needed cleaning. I think the rooms need some updating but love the location and service at the front desk can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to be back!”
Reviews.Author: jobrom123
Reviews.Content: My family has been going here since it's been called the old name. I'm pretty sure this is the BEST family hotel in Daytona. I been going to this hotel for about 6 years now with my family and i'm READY to be back! The rooms are so nice and are always very clean. The indoor garden pool is very relaxing just sitting by the waterfall enjoying the weather, and the outdoor pool is very nice as well , the sixty foot water slide is so fun and is a huge hit! I wish the pool wasn't so crowded! The Viking Kafe is a great addition, we always eat there at least once during our stay! The idea of the wristbands are great, because your pool is such a hit; we probably would get strangers from the beach! I love waking up in the morning and walking on the beach and then relaxing on the Sun Deck (the grassed area with lawn chairs) waiting for the pool to open. The hot tub is nice because it is shaded and it gets you away from the sun for awhile! All together this is a great hotel! And congrats on your TripAdvisor award. Thank you for such nice workers, and greaaat quality! See you in June! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation at a REASONABLE price. :)”
Reviews.Author: Aug211993
Reviews.Content: We're staying here now, and I have to say our whole family LOVES it. This is our first visit, and it won't be our last. When we first pulled in the parking lot, it made me smile to see "IN GOD WE TRUST" on the sign. For that, let me say, 'Thank you'. :). We are staying in the newer buliding and the first room we were given, wasn't big enough. When we asked for a bigger room, we were QUICKLY and nicely accommodated for a small upgrade fee. The gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and nice. The rooms aren't anything really fancy, but we knew that from reading the reviews here and didn't care because we weren't planning on being in our room all day, every day. lol. We've been spending most of our time on the beach and at night, we go to the pools or hot tub. The wi-fi IS a little 'spotty' and it comes and goes, but, again, we're on vacation and haven't spent a lot of time on the Internet. It would be nice if the safes were updated. We lost $1 (it's 50 cents per use) just TRYING to use it. :(. When you pull the key out, it's supposed to lock. BUT if you turn the handle quickly/firmly, it opens. So we didn't leave valuables in the safe. But, no big deal. The view is AMAZING! We can sit on the balcony at night and listen to the waves......VERY relaxing. It's just a few steps---literally---to the beach. It's not crowded at all, which we love. I don't think you'd be disappointed if you stay here. We sure love it. :). Thank you Sun Viking Lodge! The Walker Family

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place”
Reviews.Author: Casie L
Reviews.Content: this was my second time staying at this hotel and it wont be my last. the room was very clean and reasonable for a hotel on the beach. All the staff have a great attitude and are very helpful. they always have activities for kids and families to enjoy....for expample, because we stayed during Easter, they had an "Easter egg" hunt (which was candy spread out all over the court yard area) and a cookout on Easter Sunday. both pools and hot tub are very clean and a very nice size where it doesn't feel crowded. and for those travelers who have little ones, they have a kiddie pool too. but one of the best parts is...it's right on the beach!!! you walk down a flight of stairs and your feet hit sand. it really is a great place for a couple or family to stay and I would suggest this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids and very clean”
Reviews.Author: familystay10
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere and pool area is geared toward kids. Great slide in the outdoor pool. This is not an upscale, expensive resort, but our room was VERYclean with new carpet and paint. The bathroom impressed me the most in regards to cleanliness. My only negative is the size of the room. It has a small kitchen but don't think this is a condo. It is really a glorified hotel room. A bit too small really. But for the price, clean and family friendly is a plus. The beds are not comfy but do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: cherene39678
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed for 3 nights ,and the hotel was great! We had a kitchen efficiency with full fridge and all the cookware you want and need.The rooms were very clean and well kept.We had and ocean front room with a beautiful view.I almost booked my room for next year when we were leaving.Great location and my kids loved!!!the waterslide.The cafe had good food and everyone that worked there was very courteous,I highly recommend this hotel for people with families.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ted G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during Bike Week 2012. I have attended Bike Week for many years, but never stayed here. I took a shot based on TripAdvisor reviews. I had a very pleasant experience. From the moment I walked in the office to check-in, until the morning I checked out, the staff was courteous, friendly and helpful. They made you feel welcome. I had a room with a kitchenette. The room was clean and well maintained. While I didn't use the pool, the facility was quite nice. Even with the chaos of Bike Week and lots of motorcycles, the Sun Viking managed the bike parking effectively. They also seem to draw a well-behaved crowd. A lot of places don't manage this well. It was just another indication of how well this place seems to be run. I'll be back !!

Reviews.Title: “First time here!”
Reviews.Author: Shanfella
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Sun Viking Lodge in Daytona Beach Florida and it has been wonderful so far. We ended up getting a 2 bedroom, oceanfront suite w/kitchen and it was the best decision we could have made since we brought 5 kids. There are 2 swimming pools, inside and outside (outside has awesome water slide--though fast for the real small kids) and a kiddie pool and hot tub area. It does not seem crowded here at all and we were surprised considering this is spring break for most. The room is clean and neat and the kitchen comes with everything you would need to cook with. They even gave us dishtowels, silverware and dishes/cups/glasses. They have a microwave, toaster, large coffeepot (12 cup) and cookware. The suite has two televisions, one in the livingroom and one in the bedroom area and yes, one of the tv's does have the needed jacks to plug in an XBox or PS3. The fold out bed in the livingroom is large enough for two adults to sleep in, so if you want to pile a few little ones in there, you could certainly do so. There is a guest laundry and vending in both the main building and the building with the suites, which is a blessing for families with kids. I would highly recommend bringing your own towels as there is never enough. Also, if you can get your hands on a beach chair and beach umbrella, bring it. They rent them on the beach, but why not have your own. I picked up a beach umbrella for about 10.00 and the local walgreens here sells the beach chairs for 10.00 each. There are daily activities for everyone here, including coloring and games for the little ones, bingo, shuffleboard, basketball hoop (shatterproof glass enclosed for everyone's safety--smart idea!) The beach is endless and is not crowded at all. You can drive your vehicle right onto the beach! If you do bring little ones, please watch them close because they may run into the path of a vehicle, motorcycle or dunebuggy. They go slow, but you just never know. All in all this place is fantastic and we will definitely come back year after year. We got a great price and used a discount code online for deeper savings. Try Sun Viking Lodge. You won't be disapppointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: tnsportsman27
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at Sun Viking Lodge for more than 20 years. We continue to come back because the staff is kind and the rooms are always clean. We definitely enjoyed the new mattresses, they were very comfortable. The furniture is a bit dated, but I didn't go to the beach to spend alot of time in my room! We stayed the first of October, and the hotel was very quiet. We enjoyed the daily bingo, just miss that the cafe wasn't open. The only thing this hotel lacks is a decent fitness room. This a family run hotel that is focused on family & fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family - Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly G
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sun Viking Lodge since I was a kid and now I take my daughter every year. It has a homey feel to it. The staff are always nice and friendly. I've never know it to be dirty. The waterslide is awesome. Right on the beach with. I recommend the efficiency room with the small kitchenette. It's only about $10 more per night and totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE”
Reviews.Author: jillykine
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here since I was 3 years old!! Very family friendly!! LOVE the slide. All the employees are wonderful. I hadn't been there in about 10 years and I went 2 years ago - and the pool lady remembered us from when we were little!! This is the only place I stay when I go to Daytona. We went during the end of August and they have screaming deals! So many memories!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family vacation”
Reviews.Author: kadMelbourne_Fl
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Sun Viking. Twice between Christmas and New Year's and once after Memorial Day in May. Grandma, grandpa, two boys ages 8 and 9 and 3 other adults in two suites...there is something for everyone here. It's not the Ritz but then neither is my home...and it's better than my home in that the beds are comfy, we can cook our own meals (including barbecue on their gas grills),it has a heated indoor pool, a fun outdoor pool with slide and my favorite is that the suites are right on the beach. Nothing more beautiful than a sunrise over the ocean and a morning walk with on the beach with grandma and a flashlight walk on the beach at night with the kids. Excellent value and responsive staff. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: T1T2
Reviews.Content: We read Tripadvisor reviews which lead us to the Sun Viking Lodge, mostly for the waterslide and the ability to for a suite rather than just a room. We stayed over Thanksgiving. First, I agree with many other reviewers- this place is dated. Our room was clean but....could use updating. Kitchen- provides dish soap, one dish towel- paper towels holder, but no paper towels. Fridge was clean. Stove was old, foil on the burners, but clean overall (we did not use during our stay). The staff was very accomodating. They were nice and eager to honor requests. I didn't realize the poolside cafe was seasonal which was a little disappointing, also we read the pool hours and my son was ready to do at 9:00 but the waterslide doesn't open until 10:00. We stayed during the turkey run so no fault to the motel staff- it was loud in the morning when the cars where heading off to the race track. In the early hours it seemed some of the cars were in our room as they were preparing to head to the track. Now- the reason that I was reluctant to review- my 12 yr old son and I believe our room was haunted. The first night I wrote off the weird happenings and the woman's voice I heard as a dream and a couple nights of not sleeping very well. However, when my son asked if I heard the woman after the second night, I knew it wasn't just my imagination. I don't believe in ghosts, but this experience has changed my beliefs. Due to the fact we were checking out that day, no need to change hotels. The presence wasn't harmful but there was definitely a presence. I read the place was once owned by a family from NY (1940's)- when I got back I researched if anyone else experienced anything weird ironically- another NY'er felt the presence- I don't know maybe somewhere back in time, something happened in that room and there is a relationship to NY- I wouldn't not stay because of this, I might however avoid this room- overall, the place is trying, it is clean, a few improvements could be beneficial. It was definitely a different experience during our stay- especially between 3-5 a.m. !!!

Reviews.Title: “Two Decades of Sun Viking Lodge Visits”
Reviews.Author: Babybella533
Reviews.Content: When my son was 11, twenty years ago, he saw the basketball hoop at Sun Viking as we rode in our car on the beach. In Daytona, we have never stayed anywhere but Sun Viking Lodge. This past week, we visited with m son's children age 7 and 9. They enjoy Sun Viking just as much as their father did 20 years ago. We visit oonce a year and sometimes twice. We love having the peace and majestic beautiy of the balcony over looking the ocean. We love the activities: Bingo, hula hoops, basketball shootouts. Both pools (one with slide and one screened in with water fall. We love the hot top, shuffle board and of course of the beaach. The rooms are functional(full kitchen) Plan 6 has two t.v.s Second room is awesome with the sleep away couch. There is only one improvement we see: the restaurant by the pool is seasonal- we miss that very much off season. Overall, we are Sun Vikings Fans through and through. We love Daytona because we can drive our van on the beach. Sun Viking We Will Be Back Lynda Micheslon and Claire Noonan

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL BEACH WEEKEND!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed at the Sun Viking over the weekend-We enjoyed a lovely oceanfront with a full kitchen-Thanks to the Sun Viking for providing excellent service-the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly-the entire property was very clean--especially the rooms-Great weekend--I look forward to my next beach adventure--I plan on bringing my grandchildren over when they visit; and with the heated in door pool,I will not worry about the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean good for Families”
Reviews.Author: FLTraveler0813
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sun Viking for a long weekend and had a very nice time. The hotel is very clean and the staff exceptionally helpful and friendly. The pools were very clean as were the rooms. The Lodge is remniscent of more of a "motel" with outside room entrances etc. If you are looking for luxury or resort style facilities then the Sun viking isn't for you; However if you are looking for a no frills, inexpensive, clean and safe place to spend the weekend then it's perfect. the rooms are very dated but the cleanliness makes up for it. Beds were mediocre but the room size was fantastic; we are a family of four and had plenty of room without climbing all over eachother. The balcony overlooking the ocean offered breathtaking views. The Cons: Exterior of building and rooms are dated and made me think of a "Wally World" vacation as we pulled up although we were pleasantly surprised. They offer no on site restaurant or food off season; (however there is a Denny's just a short ride up the street); the pool is fairly small (although very well kept). All in all it was a good vacation; nothing really bad to say but I think I'll be looking for a new place next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Hotel in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn B
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms over Labor Day weekend. From our arrival on, it was a GREAT hotel. I have medical problems and did not book a ground room, the staff was so helpful and moved us to a ground room. Our children loved the slide, complimentary surf boards and sand castle building accessories. The pool attendant was very nice and when we called the front desk to ask if there was a specific restaurant close by, he went above and beyond to find it, even calling me back with directions! Fabulous Stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had A Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: bettdon_99
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Sun Viking Lodge. It was our first stay there and we loved it. We enjoyed the beautiful indoor garden pool with beautiful waterfall and lovely flowers. The outdoor pool was enjoyable, too. We had fun watching the kids (and grownups) on the waterslide. The hot tub was so relaxing after a day on the beach. Our oceanfront room was nice and clean with a wonderful view of beautiful Daytona Beach. The bed was very comfy and just as nice as our pillowtop at home. Our stay was right after Hurricane Irene and we found some nice shells that washed in. We appreciate that the facility is smoke-free and pet-free. We highly recommend Sun Viking and hope to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: footloosa
Reviews.Content: The pool and waterslide is why we stayed here. My kids had a blast on the waterslide The room was clean.....very out dated but clean. They also have an indoor pool that was nice. This place is GREAT for kids!!! They have a small game room and small place to get breakfast and lunch. The whole outside pool and deck area was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: dfkj3k4
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a bit dated. Customer service was phenomenal and the location was beautiful. Playground needs to have a fence protecting open access from the parking lot and road.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: porkchp
Reviews.Content: We liked the how clean the property was. Slide at the pool was great for the kids. Room was large.. ask for the rooms in the tower. We had 6 people in the room and had plenty of space. It had a sofa bed too. Location was good. The only drawback was the price... a little high for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast once again and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ThorntonAcademy
Reviews.Content: We are yearly visitors to Daytona (I have been coming since BEFORE I was born...yes, my parents were coming down even when my mom was pregnant with me, and now I bring my family!). This was our third year staying at Sun Viking, and once again we had a wonderful vacation stay there. The service is always great and the rooms always comfortable. I wish we had started going there years ago. Thanks, Sun Viking, for another great year. Can't wait to see you next August!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: christianfam
Reviews.Content: we had 3 rooms for all 11 of us in our family. 2 were on the top floor, identical with kitchens and one walked out to indoor pool, an efficiency. These rooms met our needs perfectly. The rooms are definitely dated but clean. We grilled out one night on the grills they provide. Played a lot of volleyball and shuffelboard. Had a wonderful time. Great location. Very child friendly which is what we wanted since we had 4 children under the age of 12 with us. Pools are great!

Reviews.Title: “Checked in and checked back out”
Reviews.Author: Youie07
Reviews.Content: We checked in this hotel and were put off by the smell, uncleanliness and wear and tear of the room. We went down the street to dinner, realized we could get an oceanfront one bedroom deluxe suite at the Wyndham right by the Ocean Walk for 10 dollars more. We checked into the Wyndham and I stayed there with our kids while my husband went and checked out. We had to pay for the night we didn't stay, but it was worth it to stay in a clean, large room with a big full kitchen, washer and dryer and whirlpool tub along with multiple pools and a lazy river to enjoy. I don't know how the Sun Viking Lodge is rated so highly. I felt it was truly old and gross and was mislead by positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better, seen worse, good kid slide, ants in kitchenette.”
Reviews.Author: Marshal W
Reviews.Content: The pool slide was the clincher for the kids. Hotel is older but decently maintained for the most part. The only "problem" I had with the hotel was when we came back to the room about 8:00 p.m. the kitchen table had about 20-30 little sugar ants all over it, they came up the wall or through the window area. I politely called the front desk and they sent a guy who took care of them immediately, no big deal. When we checked out the next morning the clerk asked me how everything was, so I said, "except for the ants it was fine." His reply was, and this is the problem, "This is Florida and you're going to have ants." While that may well be true, when you're standing behind a counter taking my $90 for a room with ants, THIS IS NOT THE CORRECT RESPONSE if you want me to come back! We live in Ocala and do one nighters at the beach a lot, the kids enjoy it and it's a quick getaway. So, there is waaaaay too much beach hotel competition for a desk clerk to get an attitude in my opinion. An apology or an offer for a future discounted night would have satisfied ME and ensured THEM of repeat business, but instead I got an attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary with Friends... Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn W
Reviews.Content: We stayed Thurs-Sun. and had a wonder experience. Accomodations were excellent and the staff were all very helpful and courteous... from the front desk clerks to the maintenance and cleaning staff. My wife and I had friends come to visit and they were also impressed with everything. We will definitely return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Tradition”
Reviews.Author: jobrom123
Reviews.Content: My family been staying here since it opened, we passed down the tradition every year we go! I didn't make it this year or the year before, but already booked a room for next year!!! I just can't wait, this will be my 6th time attending! The rooms were always clean, and comfortable. And the waterslide just made my day! The beach is very clean and well kept, and very affordable! The extra FREE activites just were so fun, I always looked foward to the Ice Cream Social!!! The VIking Kafe, was nice. We would get breakfast everyday there, its so yummy! I always got an omelet, or egg sandwich! The resturants around were so good, always looked foward to Barnacles, Aunt Catfishes, and Inlet Harbor! We drive to Daytona from Ohio, 17 hour car drive. Sometimes we stop at a hotel to sleep, but not this upcoming year, were going to rent a big van and sleep in the car, i love road trips, especially when going down to the Sun Viking! We really enjoy this resort, keep up the good work! See you in 308 days! (:

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family fun”
Reviews.Author: Pamgoes
Reviews.Content: We took our 3 grandgirls to the Sun Viking recently. We rented a 2 room suite with a small kitchenette, pull out sofa in the living room and 2 queen beds in the bedroom. The bedding was fresh and clean and the housekeeping service was great. We had an end unit which gave us a northern view of the beach. Unfortunately, we had a second floor room in the tower building which overlooked the indoor pool but had absolutely no view. Also, the indoor pool was like a sauna...very warm..so we couldn't enjoy the balcony at all. Other than that, the rest of our stay was very nice. The little grandgirls loved the 60' water slide and our teenage granddaughter loved the short stroll to the beach. There is a lifeguard at the pool which is a nice addition. There are plenty of onsite activities like bingo, scavenger hunts, games for kids during the day. There is a little snack shack that serves light fare for breakfast (mostly frozen pancakes, egg sandwiches, etc) and lunch which is handy but most folks we saw were fixing their own meals in the units or using the outdoor grills that are thoughtfully provided by the hotel owners. There are numerous pizza places and small restaurants nearby and many more within 10 miles. The hotel attracts guests from all over the US, many who have been coming with their families for years. It seemed that most of the guests had children ranging from infants to younger teens. This wasn't a place for romantic young couples and certainly not the place if you don't like lots of kids (at least in the summer). Overall it was an enjoyable family vacation place.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Vacation at the Viking!”
Reviews.Author: daddyschamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the fifth year in a row and had another great vacation at the beach and the resort. Some extended family came with us this time which added to the fun. The weather cooperated which makes any beach vacation that much more enjoyable. This place is not crowded at all even when at full capacity it is easy to get around, never a wait at the elevators and can always find a spot by either of the pools. Unlike other places where folks hoard all the chairs and lay their towels down early in the morning, then head back to their room. The families are all friendly and many of them are repeating quests. It is not noisy at all, except for the waterslide screams of course. The slide adds a perfect addition to the pool area. Even as my kids get older, they still love it. The beach this year (first week of August) was tremendous. Clear water, no jellyfish or seaweed. Just a great time to visit. The place is weather beaten in some areas, and is showing its age, but the staff does a great job keeping up with it. There is always staff walking around the grounds, either activities staff or maintenance. All are friendly and will assist with whatever you need. Housekeeping this year was very late in the day. That was a bummer a few times but we made do. The new beds were very comfortable, and we always stay in a room with a full kitchen to cook in, and utilize the BBQ area for grilling dinners as well. This year we went to a Daytona Cubs game for the first time. It was a great night out. The stadium was literally 5 minutes away with plenty of parking. It was a big crowd also for minor league baseball. It was a good break away from the beach for a night. Cannot wait until next summer already!

Reviews.Title: “Another GREAT vist at the Sun Viking!”
Reviews.Author: traveler460
Reviews.Content: Once again we had a great visit at the Sun Viking. In large part, the great experience is a result of the great staff. Everyone is pleasant and helpful. This is the only place in the Daytona Beach area where my wife and I would vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Had such a great time.”
Reviews.Author: Sheri9065
Reviews.Content: This hotel might be on the older side but it was better than some of the newer ones! There were activities going on during the day; scavenger hunt, bingo, sand castle building. The staff was very pleasant and the pool guy, Chris, was very friendly and kind to our kids giving them toys to play with. Our room was clean and very comfortable. The food at the cafe on site was good too. And the pool slide. Now that was freaking awesome!! We had so much fun on that thing. I'm so glad we stayed here and will definitely be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “Very well served, we recommand it!”
Reviews.Author: Sylvie_de_Ste-Julie
Reviews.Content: Have been there for a 5 nights at start, and decided to add a night to take even more advantage of the place. Cool slide, very cleanded rooms. Everything is included to cook and to be comfortable. The bed hiden in the wall is more confortable than a bed hidden in a couch! The morning we have to leave, the car doesn't want to start at all. A man from the Sun Viking maintenance did try to help us while at least 30 minutes. Tried to boost with an external machine, then tried with a car, then even tried to help with the starter... finally nothing help except to know that we have to go to a garage. A woman from the management referred us the place she goes herself where we were also very well served. By the time all this is done they let us stay with the 3 kids in the room even if the leaving time was way passed. We finally waited 2 more hours for a towing and still be kindly accepted to stay in the room with kids to watch TV. THANK YOU very much.

Reviews.Title: “We Won't Go Anywhere Else In Daytona!!!!”
Reviews.Author: george120890
Reviews.Content: What a nice place to take your family!!!! We had a Blast and our kids completly enjoyed themselves. Offers everything the big brands do but with a kind smile! We did not have to worry about the shadey crowd there or the thugs, did not feel threatened going to car at night, and not a drunk to be seen. We almost hated to go to sleep although the kids had no problem with all the swimming and games. Offers everything the big resorts do but with a feeling of when you were a kid and things were a little slower and quieter. Even though there was alot of people there it felt like we were alone and we were really able to connect with our 5 kids. We have stayed all over the world and I have to say hands down we bonded and enjoyed ourselves more here than anywhere else. And what a kind staff!!!!! EVERYONE SMILED!!!! You won't get that ANYWHERE else. Extremly helpfull and went way out of there way to make everything fun, CLEAN, and safe! We will return for years to come! See You Next Year!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay at the Sun Viking - Even Better Experience This Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: NanaBearFL
Reviews.Content: My family loves this motel. It is an older place and she has a little wear and tear on her, I can't lie. But, we have found our rooms to be clean and the service to be above and beyond expectations. The booked "last minute" this time and got a room with two double beds and a roll-away. Rooms are on the small side in our experience, but clean and comfortable. Nicely done up and well-stocked. No complaints on our room. My grandson is absolutely nuts about the slide to the pool, the location is perfect for enjoying the beach - right on it and the indoor pool area is a delight as is the hot tub. Free wi-fi and a little cafe are nice options. We enjoyed poolside Bingo game and the atmosphere for families CAN NOT BE BEAT!!!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “we had a blast...we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: shgsgrl
Reviews.Content: First time there....everyone was really friendly...the kids loved the slide and being able to walk right on to the beach. We are already counting down the days to go next year. Would go for a room with a kitchen though...but we managed just fine with what we had.

Reviews.Title: “3 Generations have visted”
Reviews.Author: YogiJM
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to tell how much we love the Sun Viking Lodge. I have been a guest of the Sun Viking since the late 70s, and now I bring my children in hopes that they too will pass on the tradition. It really is a home away from home. The activities for the kids (and adults) are a lot of fun, the pools are great, the waterslide rocks (seriously, I go on it all the time), the rooms are very nice, spacious with a kitchen. The owners have done a great keeping up the place, updating the decor, adding a 2nd building, a sundeck and even adding a small restaurant, but the quaint charm of the place that I have grown to love still remains. I highly recommend the Sun Viking to anyone looking for a wonderful, family oriented Resort with all the amentities of big hotel, but the feel of a cozy inn.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: tjka
Reviews.Content: we had a great time we like going to daytona beach and when we were there last year we saw this hotel and deceided when we go back that we would stay there. we stay 2 nites and the kids loved the pool and waterslide. and of course the beach. everyone was nice the activitys they had for the kids was fun. we are planning on going back before the kids go back to school and stay a little longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel I always stay here when I am in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: Benny M
Reviews.Content: I stay here six to eight tomes a year. I send my friends here. I have stayed here 14 times over the past 4 years and never had a complaint.Super Clean Rooms, Oceanfront, Family Atmosphere, Quiet, Awesome View, Super Friendly Staff always treat me like family, family Owned and operated and it shows. On site cafe grills a great breakfast sandwich and a awesome hamburger. They have barbecue grills you can borrow and cook out right there . Activities all day long with an onsite activity director. They have it all and will always be my first choice in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: Aarontm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my kids last weekend and had a great time. Rooms were clean and staff was friendly. My kids had fun in both pools and couldn't get enough of the water slide. They had tons of things for my kids to do including pools side activities for adults and kids. We ate at the viking cafe for breakfast on Sunday morning. The food was good and reasonably priced. I'll will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel”
Reviews.Author: artistdb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once again for a few days just to get away. We have always loved this Motel. It's clean, right on the ocean and the kids love the big slide. I love that it has a gym too. The kids love the snack bar :) . The staff is very friendly and when we needed extra towels they were there within 5 min. Can't wait to get away again soon:)

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here....disgusting!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LizinAthens
Reviews.Content: We had reservations in their one bedroom cottage across the street...we choose here after reading high reviews. DO NOT BELIEVE IT....False advertising at its worst!!!!! None of the pictures are accurate. We walked in the very tiny cottage, and it smelled so strong of mold. The love seat (no couch) had dirty cushions, and the roll away bed was strained and filthy. I pulled the cover and sheet back off the mattress of the bed in the room, and found a knat, a spider, and a very fast moving large bug. I refused to stay for more than 5 minutes. They gave us a refund, but the funds were held on in our account for about 5 days before being released. We spent the majority of Saturday (Memorial Day Weekend) looking for a place to stay for our family. We have been taking family vacations for over 15 yrs, and have NEVER experienced anything like this!!!! (by the way, the main "lodge" is nothing more than a run down motel)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: jjgblbgb
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed on the 8th floor for 3 days/2 nights. The pool and pool slide were great, beach was amazing and easy to access, hotel employees were polite and helpful. The room was clean and maid service was efficient. It's not fancy, but who needs fancy when just getting away from the average routine. Would highly recommend to anyone with kids.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: BillF_11
Reviews.Content: was pleasantly surprised when we arrived late friday night after booking a room for 8 days on short notice after out original plans fell through . the room was very clean and in very good condition and the staff was very friendly and helpful .had a great time at the sunviking and would highly recommend this place to anybody looking for a clean well maintained place to stay for a quite relaxing family vacation

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for making our visit with family such a great success”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon10
Reviews.Content: Our family recently had a wonderful w/e at the Sun Viking, enjoying the beach, swimming in the pools, and eating at the Kafe. We truly enjoyed our time together in this great family setting, all made possible by the staff and management of the Sun Viking.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Time At Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: greek5408
Reviews.Content: The room we had was great. We were on the 8th floor and could see quite a lot of the ocean from there. The pools were warm which was warmer than the Atlantic Ocean. Of course we are from Riverview, Florida, near Tampa and we are not use to cool water since the Gulf of Mexico was 80 at the time. Viking Kafe was good, glad to see that they still had that there. Being down from the main area was really good away from the busy area. The office staff was very helpful when we needed parking passes for our daughter when she joined us later in the week and also when our son joined us. We also had our grandaughter with us after their for 2 days and she made friends with other girls and really enjoyed her stay. Next time we go to Dayrona Beach we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: rmb3005
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a short getaway vacation. Our suite was oceanfront with a full kitchen and separate bedroom. The room was very comfortable and nicely appointed. The property is clean and well kept. The pool with the 60ft. water slide is fun for the kid in all of us. Nice little snack bar available for breakfast and lunch so you don't have to go out driving around for every meal. Great place for nice relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay for us, we like this place”
Reviews.Author: niagaramom
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay with Sun Viking as last year, we found that we really like this place. The kids just love the slide into the pool, the location is nice and so is the beach. Staff is always available if needed and the view from the rooms in the tower section is awesome. We find it a bit on the pricey side but is certainly nice enough to have had us come back a 2nd time. Could use a bit of updating in the decor but this wouldn't be enough for us not to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Slide made it all worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: agstaehli
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, they let us check in early, too! There were 3 adults and 5 kids in one room, which was a little small for us. We'd definitely need two rooms with a connecting door next time. There just wasn't enough space, but that just forced us to spend all our time at the pools and beach! The 60 foot slide was a blast for the kids and adults. We'd stay there again just for that reason alone. It's right on the beach, so the kids went back and forth all day long. There's a little snack bar with plenty of food choices and prices were good too, right there at the pool. Plenty of bathrooms. A playground for small kids that they loved. All in all, it was a wonderful experience and we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location; clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Nightrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my graduation from a local university (I was the crazy person on the beach in my cap and gown if you saw that) I got an excellent last-minute deal and read the previous reviews here on tripadvisor to make my decision. I checked in late and received a room on the first floor of the larger building. Normally I don't like the first floor, but this was perfect for two road-weary people carrying luggage. The room was small but very cozy and clean. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The water took a while to warm up in the shower, but the pressure was good. Cleanliness is very important to me in a hotel, and this place did not disappoint. Great location right on the beach, and seemed safe with many older couples and families. I felt very comfortable there and slept well. Wi-fi worked with no issues. Daytona has a lot of older hotels with their own sort of charm-think neon signs and vintage Vegas-type kitsch. It's really fun, but if you are used to the Ritz-Carlton and Belvedere bringing you your afternoon tea, this is not for you. If you like a good value and a clean room in an excellent location, I recommend this place. I would probably stay here again if I return to Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Well spent weekend!”
Reviews.Author: bethmichelle
Reviews.Content: I must admit that when we pulled in the parking lot, I thought that I made a mistake making reservations here, but was pleasantly surprised when we entered our two room suite on the 4th floor. Absolutely, beautiful ocean view! The kitchenette was stocked with pots & pans, silverware, plates, cups, cooking utensils. The staff even puts aluminum foil on the baking pans in the oven! Bathroom was clean and beds were comfortable. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: born2travel83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two room suite that I had booked this hotel through hotels.com and got a much cheaper rate than the one advertised on the hotels website. I think the room was advertised at $150 per night and the room was definitely not worth that! Our room smelled funny when we entered (not the typical beach hotel smell, may have been coming from the air conditioner). We ended up buying 2 glade plug-ins (one for each room) and that helped tremendously. We also opened the windows to help with the smell and when we were closing them, they started to fall forward out of the track. After being plugged in for just a little while we didn't even notice the smell. The rooms were very spacious and pretty clean. The balcony has a regular door instead of a sliding door, which I couldn't prop open. There were 2 chairs and a small table on the balcony. The room seemed a little old but it appeared as though some of the rooms were being remodeled while we were there. We stayed on the 3rd floor which is the first floor that allows for oceanfront views because of the indoor pool. The view was very nice. If you are booking a room by the indoor pool you should know that it is pretty loud in that area even if there are not a lot of people down there because of the echo. I am not sure how loud it is in the rooms however. Also, there is nothing separating the 1st floor rooms from the pool area, so when you open your door you are standing in the pool area. This may be an issue for some travelers. The pools and grounds were very nice and there were plenty of chairs in the grass and around the pool area. The hotel staff was very nice and were seen about the property quite often. There was plenty of parking and it was all near the entrance. There were lots of activities for kids including contests and games. The food at the cafe was pretty good although at times they got a little busy and there was a bit of a wait, because there was only one person working. The prices were a little high, but not bad considering the convenience. The beach in front of the hotel was very nice, and is a part of the beach where driving is allowed. It is in a quieter section of town so there wasn't much traffic on the beach or on the road. This was not the best nor the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and I would stay here again, but only if I book it from a discounted website.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: pecopeco1
Reviews.Content: clean, great water slide, safe, nice staff. I'll go back...

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Slivovic
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome! We stayed in a cottage across the street from the hotel. Perfect. 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, full kitchen, sun room. Clean with comfortable beds. It was the price of a hotel but without the hassel of noise! You can't beat the price. Loved the pools and the beach. I used the hotel computer for free to print out our boarding passes. Front desk staff and life guards are very nice. Their Viking Cafe allows you to eat poolside and the food is good! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Recharge and relax with all the extras that make you feel special.”
Reviews.Author: JayeM56
Reviews.Content: I visited with my daughter and her boyfriend (both college students 22 yrs old) and our 3 day stay was amazing. The hotel is not the Ritz Carlton but for us, we do not want the price and the swank. Our room was perfect, very clean and great layout. From check-in and throught our stay the staff was fabulous. They were friendly, professional and helpful. If someone in you party has a birthday or other event they will put it in lights on their marquee. The pool, jacuzzi, grounds, etc. were clean and well maintained. We also really enjoyed the little cafe on the premisis. The home cooked breakfast by the ocean was yummy. We found a diamond that suprised us and we will return many times.

Reviews.Title: “lots of fun, great friendly staff, clean, entertaining, lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: hicksFt_Wright
Reviews.Content: a really great family place to vacation. the staff is very friendly, we were in a cottage (6 people) & it was just great. this was our second year with grandkids & we will try to do it again every year as long as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: webecapps
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I (along with our Indian motorcycle) stayed here during Bike Week 2011. The hotel was clean, quiet and the customer service was terrific. The beach was spectacular and the hotel location is just a short drive away from all the Bike Week activities. We booked our room late and Gary at the front desk was very helpful - he even notified us when another room became available due to a cancellation. We definitely plan to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “No where better :)”
Reviews.Author: terri024
Reviews.Content: I will never stay anywhere else in Daytona. Food is good, staff is great, rooms are wonderful...and then there is the rock slide! Best place in daytona!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioFundaddy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Daytona many times, and I have to say this is the best value for a family. The rooms are older but really well kept. We enjoyed having a full kitchen and great views of the ocean. Right in front of the sun viking lives a school of dolphins they are there every morning and every evening jumping out of the water and riding waves that was a highlight for sure. There is an overall pride in and about this place and their staff, they keep it really clean and kept up, you can tell they care. You see the staff every morning setting up for the day, nothing is left unchecked. Great pool for the kids with a huge slide, shuffle board, hot tub etc. etc. etc. If your staying beach front in Daytona you will love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous family vacation courtesy of Sun Viking”
Reviews.Author: Nurseangie1113
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Sun Viking for family vacations for over 25 years! The place is great! The rooms are clean and reasonably priced. There are numerous activities for the whole family throughout the day including Bingo, basketball shooting contests, treasure and scavenger hunts, penny dives in the pool etc. The water slide is a huge hit with everyone as well - big enough to be fun for older kids and small enough not to scare preschoolers. There is a cafe for breakfast and lunch with great food and good prices. The staff are friendly and efficient. We would recommend SVL and Daytona Beach to any family looking for lots of fun at a reasonable price. Within walking distance of mini golf and shopping. Quick driving distance to Ponce Inlet lighthouse, turtle and bird rehab museum, flea market, Speedway, water park, go-carts etc. Give them a try - they will make you feel like family!

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Time”
Reviews.Author: WinchesterSailing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend and had a blast. Perfect weather, beautiful view off our oceanfront balcony. This place is older and a little outdated, but our room was clean and we slept awesome. The pools stay open late and my kids absolutely loved the water slide. My wife really appreciated the wind block at the pool because it was pretty breezy on our second day. I also noticed the elevators were really fast and never waited over a few minutes. My favorite part of the trip was going to the Lighthouse at ponce inlet, it will wear you out going to the top but the view is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel, just one hiccup.”
Reviews.Author: Happygator46
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 102 from March 18 to March 20 for my 14 year olds Spring Break. I also have a 5 year old. We were pleasantly surprised on the location of the room. Literally 5 feet from the pool, ground floor. One of two. The room was spacious and clean and the hotel staff friendly and accomodating. Loved the young Lifeguard there and actually watched him save a child while sitting by the pool that nobody else seemed to notice. He was very good, attentive to the children and helpful. My daughter finally tried out the slide on day 3 and then we couldn't get her off of it!! The only problem we had was that our air conditioner started having issues, loud noises like it was growling. I called the front desk early in the morning of Saturday, day 3 and they said they would send someone immediately to look at it. When I got back from the beach at 5, nothing had been done and it was quite hot. I called again and they only offered for us to change rooms! OMG, we had too much stuff to change rooms! So the third night we suffered in the heat and stuffiness. Mind you it wasn't hot outside but when you cannot open a window it gets stuffy! The next day, our checkout day, we were sitting by the pool and watched while they removed the entire air conditioner unit and replaced it. Now I ask, this took about an hour, as we watched, why couldn't they do that for us on Saturday? Other than that, this hotel really is nice and clean and we will surely return, but I feel they could've been more accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mamejar2
Reviews.Content: The hotel employee"s were very friendly and helpful.It was very clean and the cafe had great food,not expensive.I stayed during bike week,they wre able to get me in my room as soon as I got there.I will recommend them to everyone,I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bike week”
Reviews.Author: rritchie8080
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sun Viking for 3 nights and 4 days, it was awesome!!!!!! Great guest services!!!!!!!! There was not a need that was not met. They gave us good information on the area and attractions in the area too.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhert
Reviews.Content: After staying in many hotels along the strip of Daytona Beach over the past thirty years I have attended Speedweeks, I am pleased to say Sun Viking is, by far, the most clean and pleasant of all that I have stayed at. The grounds, and pools are attended to frequently. The view is great. The hotel is away from the most noisy part of the strip. I have stayed at the Sun Viking the last two visits and will stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, city was a little dull”
Reviews.Author: Tobykinz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sun Viking Lodge during our last summer vacation. The hotel was very clean, the staff was very kind and hospitable, the pools were nice but overly crowded, the area was safe,... Don't get a poolside room-- they're insanely loud. There wasn't enough parking right by the hotel-- we had to park across the street several times. Other than that, the hotel was wonderful!! We got a free towel when we checked in. Daytona Beach was "dead" when we were there. The only things to do were go to the beach or Daytona Lagoon. I think it would be more fun if you were either an older couple or a young family. The Big Kahuna restaurant was wonderful!!! You should definitely go eat there. A town or so over is a restaurant called Aunt Catfish's. It is even better!! We went to Orlando most days because there wasn't much to do in Daytona. The chocolate factory in Daytona was nice, the lighthouse museum was cool, and the boardwalk was somewhat fun.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FAMILY TIME”
Reviews.Author: MountainMaw
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stqy at the Sun Viking - the staff wss exceptionally willing to make our stay confortable, clean and entertaining. This is a family style vacation place with a full range of things to do. The wind break at the outdoors pool was such a blessing - we happened to hit a very windy time at the beach and instead of missing lounging around the pool in the sunshine, we were ableto spend afternoons doing just that. The staff strives to make your stay enjoyable = Tina in the Kafe is top of the line! Our room was on the top floor and it was a terrific view of the beach, the lights of town - and I'd recommend it to anybody that was looking for a good vacation at a terrific value!

Reviews.Title: “Dated and haunted...yet clean”
Reviews.Author: haleyscomet389
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sun Viking Inn for about 1 week. We had a very nice view of the ocean and the staff was nice. We picked this because it was further away from many people. The hotel is very dated, but it was clean and the staff was very nice. However, we had a very hard time getting our room cleaned. Some days we didn't get our room cleaned untl 5 P.M. I also believe that the Sun Viking Inn is haunted as I saw and heard a woman multiple times during my one week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and excited to go again!”
Reviews.Author: ktate82
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Sun Viking Lodge, but it will not be our last! As we were driving to our hotel, we saw some hotels that looked quite dated and was a little worried. But when we got there, it was very nice. The decor was not overdone and the landscaping was pretty. Check in was easy and fast, and after driving for 15 hours....thats a blessing! We had a suite on the 8th floor and had an amazing view. The whole room was very clean, even the kitchen and fridge. We sat every morning out on the balcony to watch the sunrise. Very peaceful. The staff was all friendly. They always smiled and said hello. We asked at the front desk for directions and they were very friendly, even drew us a map! Even the other guests were always plesant. They have two pools that offer a nice variety and my kids loved the slide. The pools and the beach were not crowded and it was nice to be able to spread out. We didn't do any of the activities planned, but it was nice to have that option. My kids also really enjoyed the playground. We are planning another vacation to Daytona Beach in 2011 and are planning to stay here again. Anyone who asks me where to stay, I tell them to stay here. Its a great value for an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip for fall break”
Reviews.Author: IndianaVacationers
Reviews.Content: I work for a resort hotel so I have high but realistic expectations. Sun Viking was great. The room was nice, kitchen was convenient and pool, water slide, beach, and ocean were great. The staff we met (check in agent, housekeeper on Monday, activities director and check out agent) were all nice and helpful. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing, great rooms, pool, and activities”
Reviews.Author: JOEYBChicago
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Sun Viking this past September for 19 days. We were there in 2009. We are the couple who was there in 1979, and decided to come back in 2010. We ran into the same couples that were there in 2009. Had a wonderful time together. We played bingo together and had the coffee clacth together.. We adults acted like children, with getting involved in the blowing bubbles, and even the water baloon toss. We have a deposit for same time, but all of September 2011. Couldn't complain about the weather. In the low 90's, no hurricanes. It is a great family run place. MICHELE AND JOEY Blecha

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful beach, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mirggus
Reviews.Content: The view from our 8th floor balkony was wonderful, we just had to remember turn the ac off, othervice there was kind of urine smell, yuck... The beds were comfy and everything but carpet was clean. It felt sticky. Staff was very friendly. Our kid loved the pool, the playground and especially the beach. I did not sleep well because of the elevator machineryn was located somewhere close to my pillow. A nasty weeeeeeek, snnnnnt and tumps every time someone used it. Huhhh! We had an unwanted quest in our room. From behind the bathroom mirrow came a brown largish, flat incect. I have never seen a cockroach, maybe it was not one of those, I dont know...

Reviews.Title: “Your kids will love this place...”
Reviews.Author: LoneCanexpat
Reviews.Content: ...if you don't have kids look elsewhere. This hotel is exactly as it presents itself. We arrived here with my brother's family and their kids had an absolute blast! Yes the rooms are a little dated, but I think you get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Read the negative reviews here first - or you'll be in for a shock”
Reviews.Author: anonme
Reviews.Content: Firstly I have to agree with other more positive reviews for cleanliness and family friendly atmosphere - and I never received anything but courteous and friendly service from the staff. This was my first visit back to Daytona beach in over 20 years and - Boy, what a dumpy beach/area this is. Something very horrible has hit this town. Condos are mostly vacant and the homeless are everywhere. Taking your kids to the boardwalk? Make sure you have them back to the hotel before dark. We had swearing screaming adults threatening violence in our proximity and decided it was past time to leave. We couldn't have scrambled fast enough! If you have the choice - go to Clearwater Beach on the Tampa side or even St. Augustine if you must stay in this general area. Biggins topless bar is across the street giving you a good idea of the class of the area. This side of the beach is more quiet than the boardwalk area - but I think that all the smarter people chose to stay elsewhere (Hilton for instance) - hence the reason for the quiet. On to the Lodge critique - yes - it's not been updated since at least the 80's - mauve decor, brown particle board doors, seriously old appliances in the kitchen along with so many cosmetic patching needs. We overlooked the indoor pool area and it felt very 70's with all the plants growing into the balcony so there was no view except for these palm plants which were in serious need of a pruning. They say they have internet access but we could only get a connection if we stood on our tip toes off the side of the balcony. Service was good - Kafe food met our needs and the kids didn't seem to mind any of this. But if you have anything above low expectations for the asthetics of your accommodations, look elsewhere. The marketing material for this place is very deceiving. I'm not writing this review to do you a favor folks so you don't repeat my mistake - heed my warning...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing, vacation!”
Reviews.Author: dmalley
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Sun Viking Lodge and it is a wonderful experience. Everyone is helpful and friendly. We have three teenagers from ages 12-17 and they enjoyed every bit of their vacation. They brought friends and were impressed with the 60 foot water slide. We made reservations for next years vacation at Sun Viking Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, Friendly and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: JGo574
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sun Viking Lodge based on the many glowing reviews we read on this site. We were very happy with the establishment. Everyone employed by the motel was friendly and personable, the pools were very well maintained, the water slide was a huge hit with my entire family (not just the children) and the cafe' had great food for very reasonable prices (just remember to have some cash on you b/c they do not take credit cards). The rooms were comfortable and very clean. I was extremely pleased with our stay at the Sun Viking Lodge and have already started trying to figure out when we can go back for our next vacation!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Orlandopeeps
Reviews.Content: We chose this location based on the reviews on this site. We arrived Saturday for a night stay....living in Orlando we can go for 1 night. Thank goodness it was for one night only. It was not expecting the Ritz but this is a far cry from reasonable. Not sure how this was rated #6 in all of Daytona. The bed was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever EVER slept in. Worst night sleep ever. EVER. The other guests staying there were...interesting. And seemed to party late into the night when we are attempting sleep in the nightmare of a bed. I will give it a high score for cleanliness, as it was clean. I however, will never ever stay there ever again. Would have been more comfortable sleeping on the floor. And the pool has a 22 person capacity and was well over the limit the entire time we were there. Gross water.

Reviews.Title: “BEST FAMILY ENVIRONMENT. WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: chasityb_ohio
Reviews.Content: We found the Sun Viking Lodge with the help of the staff at the Comfort Inn. We showed up to our prepaid reservation at Mainsail in Ormond beach to find that they overbooked. The girls at the Comfort Inn (which was booked full) got on the phone and started calling all hotels in the area. They suddenly remembered eSun Viking. When they called Sun Viking she informed the staff of my situation and they agreed to provide us with a 25% discount and did not charge us the higher weekend rate as we checked in on Saturday. When I arrived at the Sun Viking I found that it was American Owned and Operated, very friendly staff, everyone spoke english. The office was very clean and very packed. Many people checking in. I reached the front desk to find the that the person who checked me it was the one who already knew of my situation. He was very friendly. After check in he handed me two coloring books with crayons for the kids and a free beach towel. We went to our room which was awesome, very clean, very big, with a full kitchen and the bathroom had two vanities, one in the bathroom and one outside the bathroom. Good size ocean front balcony. We stayed on the 4th floor. Elevators were very accessible. Laundry room right outside our door. Very family oriented. Each day the lodge had activities that were for the families. We played Bingo every day, did the Water balloon toss, adverteasing, card games, scavenger hunt.... The kids LOVED the waterslide. This place offered so much that we really didnt' have to leave and pay extra for activities. There was a Winn Dixie a few blocks up the road where we bought groceries for the week. The kids loved the Viking Cafe for lunch! My 5 year old loved the Cheeseburger and my 10 year old loved the cheese fries! The staff was very friendly and the guests have been coming there for many years. It was small enough to get to know the other guests but big enough to enjoy your own space. The beach access was wonderful. There is volleyball net on the beach, shuffleboard, two game rooms, an indoor pool and outdoor pool. This is the BEST experience we have ever had on a family vacation. I have found that you get what you pay for. This was a little higher than we usually pay on a vacation but it was WORTH IT! We will be returning on our next vacation! And I will refer to ALL OF MY FRIENDS!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jayman154
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was not expecting much. My husband, daughter, and I were vacationing with my 3 siblings and their families so cost was one of the primary focuses when looking for a place to stay. My husband and I typically stay at Hilton owned hotels because I have been a diamond club member for several years, so I had already decided that as long as the room was clean, I would just deal with the "motel" atmosphere that I do not typically stay at (I know that sounds snobby, but I truly do not mean it that way...I traveled for work for several years and just became accustomed to larger chain hotels). When I pulled in, I could tell the Sun Viking was an older, smaller establishment and just kept my fingers crossed that the rooms were clean. They were actually pretty nice! It looks like they have been updated in the last couple of years (nothing fancy, but certainly much better than expected!) and had some great amenities! We booked 2 - two room suites so there were 4 adults in each room, 3 kids in one and 2 kids in the other and I didn't feel like we were cramped at all! The "Murphy" bed was soooo much better than having to deal with a pull-out sofa and very easy to use. The hotel has an activities director who makes announcements reminding everyone they have 5 minutes before an upcoming event (bingo, basketball toss, face painting, sandcastle building, etc). My husband and I both remarked that it felt like we had a “cruise director”!! The hotel even had a grill you could reserve for free each night and provided the cooking utensils! The outdoor pool was a little small, but there were 2 of them which was nice in case you need to get out of the sun. The slide was awesome and they did a pretty decent job monitoring the kids coming down on top of each other. That one I blame more on parents who weren’t paying attention to their kids though. The only complaint I have about the pool is that there are signs stating no smoking in the pool area which several people disregarded. It would have been nice if the employee monitoring the slide and pool had asked them to go to a smoking area. They were sitting within a few feet of the baby pool and the breeze was blowing the smoke directly towards the big pool...definitely not what I wanted to inhale at 6 1/2 months pregnant with my 17 month old daughter right there.
