I could have said something to the pool attendant or the front desk, but I hate to be “that person”. It only happened the last day, so I just put up with it and tried not to breathe too deeply. One thing to note is that parking is very limited here. There is only 1 parking spot allotted per room, which we did not know before booking. As I mentioned, 2 families were sharing rooms so we obviously had 4 vehicles total. Apparently, when you book through Expedia, as we did, you are not made aware of all hotel policies. The front desk clerk, Larry??, was nice about it though. The hotel was not extremely busy so we just had to check with him to make sure there were still enough spaces on site. There is an overflow lot across the street, but luckily we did not have to use it. I think if we go back there, we will just check into renting a 15 passenger van so we don’t have that problem!! Just kidding...kind of... Anyway, the room was great, staff was great, pool was great, slide was great...a great vacation that the whole family was able to enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is wonderful. 2 pools and a...”
Reviews.Author: ydavis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. 2 pools and a hot tub, 1 pool inside (heated) with a great water feature and 1 outside which has a large water slide for all to enjoy. Several relaxing beavh chairs to enjoy while you watch the other guests lounge on the beach only feet away. The staff at this establishment are absolutely wonderful and will assist you in any way possible. I will be returning on my next vacation weekend to Daytona. Y. Davis Ps. charlie is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: angel80anna
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another wonderful vacation at the Sun Viking! Everything was great, no complaints! Rooms were clean & had everything we needed. Maids did a great job each time they came to our room. Maids were also very friendly when meeting them in the elevators or halls. Everyone who works there is very friendly! We ate lunch there everyday & the food was great! The pools were clean & beautiful. The kids loved the slide. There are lots of games for the kids, they had so much fun! We never had any problems with chairs at the pool or parking. This is a great place for familys! We all had a wonderful time & can't wait to come back! Oh and, could someone please tell Darrell (hairwrap guy) Adrianna said "GIRL'S RULE~BOY'S DROOL"!

Reviews.Title: “Sun Viking ***** Daytona Beach *”
Reviews.Author: Shangri_la_Seeker
Reviews.Content: The people of Sun Viking Lodge are doing the right things in trying to keep people wanting to come back. But Daytona Beach city fathers need to listen up. Sun Viking has everything a family would want for a vacation. Great pool area with slide. Beach was clean and the areas by the pools are clean and well appointed. Nice Kafe for breakfast and lunch but no dinner or late night. A playground for the kids and activities everyday for kids of all ages. Now lets talk about Daytona Beach. It is not what it was 20 years ago. Many of the older eating places are gone. The hotels are either gone and replaced by condos or vacant lots. The only amusements are mini golf, the go karts are gone. Half of the gift shops are closed because empty condos don't bring customers. Boardwalk at ocean walk is a joke. Fifteen dollars for 3 peolpe to ride a ferris wheel is not family friendly. I don't know why people would go to the beach to go inside to a movie but really there isn't much else to do other than eat. There is a world famous bandstand there, put on some type of entertainment nightly, even a local signer, but something to bring people in. So back to the Sun Viking. It is a wonderful place to stay, I hope it stays there for many more years. Larry at the front desk great help, and Larry at the pool, two different people ,very interesting to talk too.

Reviews.Title: “Here is an honest review”
Reviews.Author: Engbergs
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous about trying an new hotel in the Daytona area as we have been loyal to another local hotel for many years. This year however there were six of us going and the old hotel could not give us a reasonable rate on two rooms, so we ventured into the unknown. After reading some reviews about the lodge we decided to give it a try. There are some bad reviews about the hotel on this site but what stood out to us is the way the management took their time to address the bad reviews and accepted both the good and bad criticism. We stayed from June 19- June 25 and had room 806 which was an ocean front with two queen beds and a pull out bed. There was a kitchenette with all the items you would expect ie; toaster, pots,pans,silverware,cutting board, tea kettle etc. Each room had a television in it with cable. The beds were not the most modern but they slept well. I even slept on the pullout a couple nights and it was not as bad as I thought it would be. The bathroom looked to be a bit more updated then the reast or the room.The balcony view was amazing overlooking the ocean. The property consisted of an indoor pool with waterfall, outdoor pool with slide, and a hot tub gazebo. There was also plenty of lounge chairs availble at all times of the day. The pools did get a little crowded in the early noon but we just went to the ocean during that time. We found ourselves alone in the pools many times around 5 or 6. There are two game rooms, nothing real fancy. Two laundry rooms. A computer room with internet and a printer availible. A workout room was also availble. The daily activities were funf for the kids and the staff was great with them. Overall this was a great experience for our family. This is not forsomeone who expects the most up to date or posh lodging. This is aimed towards families with kids. It was well worth our money and we will return. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a stress free family vacation at a hotel where the staff is extremely friendly. Two thumbs up from this Ohio family. Thank you Sun Viking Lodge for a great week.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite”
Reviews.Author: cholu2
Reviews.Content: We had our vacation for the second time in Daytona Beach at Sun Viking Lodge. Since we are Canadians from Québec, we stay for quite a long period of time (at least 15 nights). So we look for great places to stay. Actually, we only have good words for Sun Viking Lodge and the staff. It's a great place to stay. It's a nice family place with many convenient features (pools, free internet, animation, etc). The place is also ideal for a couple like my wife and I, so its obvious that we'll return in the future. The administration staff are nice people and they were very accomodating in our special situation on our last trip. Vacationers from Québec

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: rpmx1000
Reviews.Content: Sun Viking is the best value on the beach. Clean rooms, nice pools, friendly staff, great ocean front location. This is the place for family fun.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!! writing this ahead of time”
Reviews.Author: bgjon5
Reviews.Content: Its HORRIBLE that no other hotel comes close to the FUN we have at Sun viking (sorry for scaring you Mrs Brown) see we know exactly what to expect every time we come to Sun viking that our visit isn't until June 19th to....err whenever we wanna leave! probably a week so this has been a GENERATION of coming to the Viking, we absolutely love our visit each and every time we come here from the adults to the kiddies..all the pool's are great, the activities are great and oh wait I forgot about the water slide! how cool is that!! so this is to all the negative comments that you see..not sure what these people are talking about! if you want chocolates on your pillow with down comforters and pillows go pay 190+ a night at some boring hotel, if you want a kick butt time with you're friends, kiddies and family come to the Viking! the ONLY downfall I have is no responses for positive comments..course the Browns will be on here all day if they did that. Thanks guys for MANY of years of great family fun....see y'all in a few weeks! Love ya the Richter/Sadler families!

Reviews.Title: “not happy”
Reviews.Author: nofuninthesun
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 9:00 4/4/10 everything went fine checking in. We actually got in our room earlier than 11. The chairs around the pool were taken. What I mean by taken is there were people but alot of the lounges had towels on them. That was fine. I just told myself "we'll get one tomorrow." Our room was overlooking the pool with the slide. Paid almost 200 dollars. I woke up at 7am to look down at the pool to see nothing but towels on EVERY chair arond the pool. I went to the office to see what could be done. All I wanted to do was read a book in peace before everyone came down. The office said I had to wait for the pool attendant to get there at 9 am and he would remove the towels.He did not arrive til 9:45 and did NOT remove any towels.I got to sit on the balcony and watch a bunch of towels sunbathe for 2 hrs and 15 minutes. I then called BOB the so called manager and was told 'PEOPLE ARE PEOPLE' and we don't know why they do that and I'll have to bring it up again at our meeting. The owners have been told about this before and do nothing!!!!!!!!! I basicly had to stay on the balcony to watch our kids have fun on the slide. I watched for two days for a seat around the pool and they let PEOPLE save there seats for hours!!! This was my second time visiting and my last. They need to find a new manager, He was no help and not very professional. I don't understand why the people in the office did not move the towels. They said it is first come first served. The towels were there ALL night. Then one of the guests called me a B____ when I left to go to the office. My two neices 7&8 were standing there with my bro when she said it!!!! All i got from the manager 'PEOPLE ARE PEOPLE!!!!" NO sorry of any kind of apology for this terrible experience. If it weren' t for the kids I would have left then.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing with a lot of fun thrown in.”
Reviews.Author: gababble
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The kids enjoyed the water slide and pools - indoor and outdoor. The adults were able to lay back and relax. The staff was friendly and helpful. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: angel80anna
Reviews.Content: Started coming to this hotel in 1995 with my Children, now I bring my Grand-Children! We LOVE this place & wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. Once we didn't have reservations & they only had a room with no view of the ocean. We didn't want that & chose to check out some other hotels, we went back & got the room with no view! The rooms are clean & have everything you need. The Cafe has great food! The people who work there are so friendly! They must love their jobs because, they have been there for a long time. It's like, you are so use to seeing these people if you don't, you wonder about them! Very family friendly, always something for the kids to do. Like the idea of the wrist bands at the pool, that way they know who belongs there. I have an autistic child & they are so nice to him. In the 15 years we have been staying here, we have never had a problem & LOVED our visit! We come from Virginia & stay the weekend before going on to Orlando. I would just love to spent my whole vacation at Sun Viking, but the kids just have to go to Disney! We'll be back in June, can't wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Sun Viking Lodge is so much Fun!”
Reviews.Author: cbsNC
Reviews.Content: My Family and I had the vacation of a lifetime at the Sun Viking Lodge in Daytona Beach. The kids loved the waterslide, the adults loved the sundeck and on that one rainy afternoon we all were greatful for the indoor pool. The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. Thank you Sun Viking for all the wonderful memories. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat relaxation and excellent value in this current economy!”
Reviews.Author: velvmex
Reviews.Content: We just had the best vacation! Very relaxing in the hot tub and on the beach. The indoor pool is a gorgeous alternative if you've had too much sun or the weather isn't quite what you'd like. Most theme parks are only an hour drive and you don't have to "live" in their location. Everything you need is right at your fingertips! The staff was very helpful and friendly, the rooms nice and clean, the way we like them. The rates are even reasonable. What's not to like?!!! We're going back in a hearbeat,

Reviews.Title: “An very familiar hotel - Um hotel muito agradável”
Reviews.Author: AguiarPendo
Reviews.Content: We've been in Sunviking for almost a week. Personal is very kindly, rooms are clean, price is nice. I've been in Daytona almost every year and I see that it is hard to find good and clean hotel in that area. But Sunviking has a nice price for a good service. I and my husband are planing stay there this year again. The hotel is also nice for couples with kids. It is located in front of the beach and has two nice swimming pool (indoor and outside). Park is big. Place is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Viking Lodge”
Reviews.Author: dscaron
Reviews.Content: We had a HUGE room overlooking the beach with kitchenette, two double beds and a balcony on the third floor. Although it was an older hotel, it was clean, well-maintained and had beach access as well as an indoor and and an outdoor swimming pool. All staff was friendly and helpful and the rates were definitely reasonable. Loved the Axe and Shield (across the road) for the burgers and Baby Cham on tap. Drawbacks are that there are limited restaurants in the immediate area that you can walk to and the breakfast that they offer at the lodge was expensive and mediocre. We found it best to have some breakfast food readily available in the room since there was a microwave, cookstove and refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “if only the weather had been better!”
Reviews.Author: tallybelle
Reviews.Content: we arrived early at hotel saturday oct 31st and got straight into our room after a very warm welcome in reception, the weather was hot, and waterslide a big hit with my daughters aged 13 and 5. Alas the weather went down hill the next two days and the waterslide was off, the girls cried to go back to Orlando, we checked out early tuesday 3rd november and to my huge surprise and delight we got a refund! ( a wonderful bonus as my husband is only working short time in this time of recession)Thankyou so much for that and also thank you Charlie for being so helpful and friendly. we would definately recomend this hotel in good weather!

Reviews.Title: “Good for our purpose”
Reviews.Author: 8nick
Reviews.Content: The Viking was our second visit in Florida having come from Miami. Our intention was only one night as we were aware that we were out of season with the Biketoberfest and NASCAR experience limiting the number of resorts to visit whilst in Daytona. We were aware through research that there was several Motels in the same location as the Viking, however using trip advisor the Viking stood out the most. The room was located on the ground floor and we had a pool side view. In fact only walking 10 feet from our door you would be in the pool. The room was clean, tidy and seemed to be kept very well. We had no issue with sleep at night as it seemed very quiet. The bedding, curtains and furniture was a little old fashioned, however not the end of the world. The Beach was directly behind us however it was very windy during mid October so swimming in the water or laying on the beach was a no no. We went into town and took a look around the area, but again we were not expecting too much due to the date. The only thing that was really available as a tourist attraction was the Daytona 500 experience located at the main track area. Overall. The Viking offered everything we needed. Free wireless internet, free Parking, free coffee in the morning and a safe location. (There are 2 swimming pools indoor and out and if you have kids there is also a reasonable sized slide, however no lifegaurd.)

Reviews.Title: “SUPER SPOT”
Reviews.Author: HCLBRK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September on a week night, off season. The hotel is right on the beach. Friendly staff, nice rooms. Two clean pools and a water slide. Only bad instance was no hot water in the AM.....cold shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodations for a family trip.”
Reviews.Author: NanaBearFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Sun Viking this past weekend and were happy with our room. We found the pools and hot tub exceptionally well-maintained. The kiddie pool was even above par and the slide was a lot of fun and a real bonus. We rates are very reasonable and I would certainly stay again at this property. The room was a little cramped for all of us - five adults and a two-year old, but it was clean and reasonably comfortable. The full-sized fridge was wonderful to have. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sun Viking - would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: BlueBird Watcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sun Viking Lodge at the end of June, 2009. VERY hot that week!! I had asked a friend before we traveled to recommend a good hotel since he lives in Daytona Beach. He instantly told me to check out SVL, and I am so glad we did! The pictures on their web site are true to what the place looks like! Upon check in, we received a beach towel, which was a nice surprise. The room was oceanfront, with an amazing ocean view. We did not have a kitchen in the room, but had a fridge and microwave. We had two queen beds and a pull out sofa. The room was large and clean. The bathroom was immaculate, and remained that way for the duration of our stay. The housekeeping staff does a wonderful job keeping the Lodge sparkling clean. There are two pools on site, one is indoor and one outdoor with a water slide. There is a nice little garden type area where there are lounges for sunbathing. There is a little cafe that we did not eat at, but everyone seemed to enjoy. There are organized activities for the kids, and of course, the ocean! We spent our time at the beach, and just loved every minute of it. We also enjoyed the Daytona 500 Experience at the Daytona International Speedway. It is only about 5-10 minutes from the hotel. We also visited Kennedy Space Center, which is about 1 hour 15 minutes from the Daytona area. Everyone was helpful that we encountered and the prices are very reasonable. We liked being a little bit south of the "main drag". The beach wasn't crowded, and it just seemed to have a slower pace in that area. I really enjoyed all the flowers and other landscaping. You can tell the owners and staff take great pride in this jewel. I would highly recommend this place. Go. You will not be disappointed. Try to get an oceanfront room. I think it was worth the extra cost, even though I didn't think the cost was that much!! We will definitely return to SVL if we go to Daytona Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Sun Viking!”
Reviews.Author: traveler460
Reviews.Content: We try to stay at the Sun Viking once a year. It is almost like being on vacation but still being "home." The staff has little turnover and the same familiar friendly employees are there every year. You really feel like family when you stay at the Sun Viking. The pools are both excellent and the grounds well kept. The efficiency rooms have everything you could want and if you do find anything missing, all you have to do is ask. The Sun Viking is a great place to vacation. Everytime I've tried another Daytona area hotel, I've wished I was at the Sun Viking so I've quit trying other hotels there. There are some places that may be fancier but there is no place you will be treated better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our vacation at the Sun Viking Lodge-Excellent Value; Perfect Score!!”
Reviews.Author: Bridlewood
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an awesome vacation with our three teens - 19, 17, and 15. The kids loved jumping in the waves. We loved that too. It was extremely hot but...no surprise. The Sun Viking in in a really good location on the beach, away from the very commercialized section, closer to the centre of town. We took two adjoining rooms. One had a kitchen and the other had a bar fridge and microwave. That was perfect - the teens had their own room and TV and we had our own room. Having a kitchen is a must with teens. (They also had bbqs that could be signed out. Some would wheel one close to the rooms but most were just kept in an alcove area where there are chairs set up. We ran out of propane and the owners rushed off to have the tank filled. Most would have just had us wait for another bbq to come available.) The rooms were immaculate with nice furniture. The carpets looked like new - no small feet with all the sand that must be tracked in. The desk staff was very nice and accommodating in every way. The cleaning staff was also excellent. The pools were very nice. The outdoor pool was more for kids with a super water slide. I enjoyed the indoor pool or swimming in the ocean. The hot tub was nice and plenty hot...and clean. We are frequent travellers and we will definitely go back to the Viking Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Viking Very Nice :o)”
Reviews.Author: Kasakeri
Reviews.Content: My family and I had never been on vacation before, and we were planning and saving for this Daytona Trip for about 3 years. I had happened upon the Sun Viking's web page when we started planning the dream, and I visited it every day to check if they were posting their rates for the time of year we were planning to go. As soon as they did, I called, and I spoke to Barbara the owner. She was such a nice lady and after I explained my story she made me a VIP customer right away and gave me a discount on our room!!! When we got there, we checked right in. The room was great, beds were comfy and it was nice to have a full kitchen. Only minor problem was that the large burner was a bit cockeyed but we made it work LOL. The view was breath-taking, and we always had our room cleaned by the very friendly service ladies. The pool with the slide is a huge asset. I trolled the beaches and looked at other hotels and resorts and even the ones that are considered 5 star had no kind of family set up such as this!! And the lady who takes care of the pool, LeVonne, well she was just a doll! I loved chatting with her. She was there to make sure everybody played safe and that all the partrons were happy... Even the service men who had to come in to show me how to work the stove were friendly and chatty! Anyway I loved it and I will be back in two years!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay for family fun”
Reviews.Author: frances1perkins
Reviews.Content: Our boys, ages 10 and 9, my husband and I had the MOST wonderful experience at this family lodge. The indoor garden pool is beautiful and the outdoor pool, overlooking the ocean and beach, is magnificent. The water slide going into the outdoor pool is a kid favorite. We had a full kitchen and were able to save a lot of money by not going out to eat so much. The Sun Viking Kafe offered a breakfast hard to pass up and our boys got into a "tradition" of having their fries at lunch poolside. We only stayed 4 days and wished we could have stayed longer. I highly recommend this place for anyone with kids or even teens.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: tnsportsman27
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and stocked with towels, soaps, etc. The facility was maintained and crews cleaned the outdoor area each morning. We loved the activities that the staff provided. Even though I'm an adult, I also loved the waterslide. Our family has visited Sun Viking Lodge for many years and we always look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Staycation”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumMomOf2
Reviews.Content: Great Family Weekend! Staycation with sister and kids (3, 5, 6 and 15 yrs old). The kids enjoyed the activity program. My daughter won the sand castle contest and my niece and son really enjoyed getting their faces painted. Waterslide was great fun and indoor pool was a nice retreat from the afternoon rain showers. Kids had a blast at the beach. A definite yes for the kids. The Viking Café was nice but we wish it had remained open for evening snacks. We look forward to returning with the kids next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great family value and location with lots of activities for kids”
Reviews.Author: Momof3boysFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sun Viking over Easter Weekend and had such a wonderful time with our kids. There were so many activities to keep our kids busy from the Easter Egg Hunt to the Face Painting Poolside. They have an activities director that had scheduled water balloon toss and hula hoop contests. Then we were even able to grill out using their BBQ grills and this was a relaxing way to eat with the kids, save money and enjoy the beautiful weather. The waterslide was a hit with the kids and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We look forward to another stay at this hotel. It was a great value and pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: artistdb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sun Viking Lodge a few times and have always loved it. We onlt live in FOrt Lauderdael but we wanted to get away for a few days for my husbands birthday, When the kids heard we were leaving they wanted to come too. They love the 60ft water slide and my son loves the basketball court. The rooms as always are so clean.Love having the ocean steps away from our door. Can't wait to make another excuess to go back lol.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: NIKUP1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sun Viking in the past and now live in the area. We always recommend this resort to our Family and Friends that come to visit. We Highly recommend th Sun Viking to anyone traveling to Daytona Beach Shores, esspecially families. You will be very pleased. The Staff does a wonderful job! Keep up the good work and thanks for many years of great service.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to go with little kids!”
Reviews.Author: slrange
Reviews.Content: We're actually still at the hotel and love this place. We're here with a 3 year old, 21-month old, 3-month old, mom (me), dad and grandma. We didn't know what to expect but this place is GREAT for families with little kids. We're on the ground floor (highly recommended) and 50 feet from the pool and 200 feet (?) from the beach. They have a playground, heated indoor pool (we haven't used yet) and the pool with slide is great for the 2 older kids - they love it. The room was fine. The kitchenette worked out nice so we didn't have to leave the hotel since we didn't have a car. We're talking about coming back again next year. The only downfall is that it's $50+ for a late checkout even though there's LOTS of empty rooms. Our flight doesn't leave until 6pm. I guess I can see $50+ if it's a weekend or they were busy but it's slow now and it's Wednesday! Very friendly hotel with great amenities for families.

Reviews.Title: “Amazed by so many positive reviews... certainly not our experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Dylaness
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Daytona Beach on some personal business. We booked four nights at the Sun Viking, looking for a decent, clean, comfy place to stay that had a kitchenette so we didn't have to eat every meal in a restaurant (for the health of our waists as well as our wallets!) I wasn't expecting luxury (thank goodness) but I was really disappointed. Our room was modestly furnished (as expected) and did have a working kitchenette. The room had a really musty smell but we thought a little "airing out" was perhaps in order so we didn't think too much of it. After our first night our eyes were watering and we were having allergy-type runny noses. They'd get better during the day and then after a night in the room they were bad again. I know the hotel is aimed at families but the pools and jacuzzi were so overrun with children that it was really unpleasant for adults. We checked out a day early (sans refund) because we couldn't take the smell, noise, and itchy eyes/runny noses anymore. I also had some type of reaction (detergent, perhaps?) to the sheets and was very itchy on my arms and legs.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to come back when we can stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: Kimo77
Reviews.Content: We drove down from Atlanta and decided to stay in Daytona Beach for one night before heading to a friends wedding in Ocala. My 8 year old daughter loves water so we chose this hotel due to the many positive reviews and the 60' water slide. Sure enough, she had a blast at the outdoor pool and really enjoyed the water slide. We ventured onto the beach where she was able to dig into the sand and look for shells. The only downside to our one day was that it was very windy so it made it difficult to stay warm . We're looking to come back when it's a little warmer and we can stay a longer. When we walked into our room we did notice a slightly musty/humid smell. However, I attributed that to out proximity to the beach. The bath tub also did not drain properly but I made a note on the review sheet provided by the front desk upon check-in. Hopefully, someone will address that. Again, as others have stated, this is not the Ritz, but for a great little spot on the beach, it's a great find! The kitchenette in the room was very convenient and if we were staying longer would have been a huge plus! WI-FI worked really well. Jacuzzi was nice and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Still One of the Nicest on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: clanlamond
Reviews.Content: Went on the spur of the moment and still had a great time at the Sun Viking Lodge. Only stayed one night but it's one the best hotels for families. They had all kinds of activities(Easter egg hunt, balloon toss, etc.) for the kids besides the pools, play area, and the beach. The little cafe makes a quick inexpensive breakfast or lunch. It was Easter Sunday and they had a free cookout for the guests. We unfortunately missed that but they gave us a cute little basket of chocolate eggs when we got there! The kid's loved that! The pools are clean and relaxing; we really love the indoor pool with the waterfall and plantings and the boys love the 60 ft. slide at the outdoor pool. They're both heated but not overly warm. The rooms are always well maintained with plenty of clean towels. The bedding is a little worn but it's clean and comfortable. When I inquired at the desk about finding a certain bank branch, they printed out a listing for me of locations. They have always been welcoming to my family and once you stay, they give you a discount on future visits. **One warning for all Daytona hotels that are on the driving part of Daytona Beach. Be careful going down to play in the surf and sand. This year(2009) there has been a huge increase in auto vs sunbather accidents and it's only April.**

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2009”
Reviews.Author: batterygirl
Reviews.Content: My children and I and another family decided to drive the short distance (we're from Orlando) to Daytona for a a couple of nights. We chose the Sun Viking principally for the reviews found here and the waterslide. Wow-we were disappointed. We found this hotel to be very dated. While the waterslide was functioning, the basketball hoop was being worked on 2 of the 3 days we were there. Upon entering our room we immediately noticed ants in the bathroom and on the dresser. The odor in the room was an odd mix between cleaning supplies and room freshener. I have never seen a bed that had wrinkled sheets and pieces of white paper in it when you pulled back the bedspread. When we checked out I commented on the way that each guest is required to wear an arm band to get near the pool and was given a very annoyed look and quite a rambling lecture on why I should be happy with their system. All in all-I knew we hadn't booked at the Ritz, but still felt we should of been able to expect a clean room with the few desirable ammenities that were promised actually functioning. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing As Always”
Reviews.Author: ohio75
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for an entire week (Spring Break) and it was the first time we had been back in nearly 12 years. Checking in was very smooth and the staff was very nice and friendly (Espically Ramesh) During the week we were there, every single time we encountered a member of the maid staff we were greeted with a hello and a smile. You wont find that at many places. The Viking Kafe is great if you want to get a nice breakfeast or lunch without leaving the hotel. We had both during our stay and the food was great. The lady behind the counter who made the food was also very nice. Also was glad to see that Bingo is still going in the mornings, it is one of the things I look forward to the most while at the hotel. All in All this was a wonderful vacation for our family and we are already making plans to come back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Would stay again....”
Reviews.Author: ontariofam70
Reviews.Content: My parents had stayed here a couple of times and recommended it to us (2 parents, 2 kids,13 and 8, and mother-in-law). No disappointment here! Room on 6th floor (tower) was clean, spacious, and comfortable. Full kitchen was more than needed (full-size fridge, sm. appliances, dishes, etc.) We had 2 bathroom sinks, one outside the tub-toilet area. Maid service was fine. Staff in general were all courteous and helpful. Location right on beach had great balcony views. Both pools were very warm, clean, and enjoyable. Only have 2 minor negatives. 1. Safe in room required a quarter every time you opened it to take out your wallet. 2. One elevator was not working first couple of days causing long delays. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I Wish I Had Taken A Picture To Share!”
Reviews.Author: vrtPa
Reviews.Content: As I read these positive reviews, I'm sure they all paid the higher rate and stayed in an ocean front unit. They have two choices at this hotel, oceanfront or (for a nicer term) dark dreary closet with NO view located in a side unit facing the parking lot. Please plan on lugging your luggage up a flight of stairs (no help offered). A good idea would be to check the room before doing this. While visiting Daytona, I had planned on treating my mother to a few nights on the beach (she lives in Daytona) and chose this hotel for it's location. I did pick the run of the house rate, knowing that it was a slow week and felt we had a good chance of an upgrade. After seeing the room and the beds (my mother sat on one and was poked by a spring) we asked to see an ocean front. We did decide to upgrade, but after agreeing on a price over the hotel phone, we were then told it would be more once in the office. We were already paying a little over $100.00 for this dark closet. We did ask to leave and they did refund our money. They made it clear they decide where people stay with this rate (busy or not) and did not want our business. We found a lovely, clean room (OCEAN FRONT) at the Days Inn up the street. The clerk couldn't have been nicer and even offered to help with our luggage even though they had an elevatore. We stayed in an ocean front at a cost lower than what was offered for the awfull room at the Sun Viking. Days Inn is now owned by Wyndham and have wonderful beds. We had a great time. I just wish I had taken a picture of that room ( Sun Viking) to share........

Reviews.Title: “First Class Operation”
Reviews.Author: plowther
Reviews.Content: We could not have picked a better place that suited our family... The rooms are well appointed, and our kids loved all of the activities. We were made to feel welcomed by the staff, and look forward to returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: pdburdick
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! I highly recommend the Sun Viking Lodge. The people were wonderful, our room was comfy, the pool felt so good. The beach and pool that's all we needed. We plan on going back next winter and talked about the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great for wedding guests!”
Reviews.Author: wifeybulls
Reviews.Content: I got married the last weekend in June, 2007. I reserved 3 of the cottages for my family and friends, as well as, several oceanfront rooms. My guests were able to spend the day in the sun by the pool or on the beach. The kids loved the activities program, and they all appreciated the convenience of the cafe. I have several friends getting married this summer and I plan on recommending the Sun Viking Lodge as a place for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Sun VIking Lodge!!”
Reviews.Author: ALesaT
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sun viking many times and will only stay there when we vacation in Daytona Beach. The staff is awesome and you can truly call this resort "family friendly!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: smassler
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Sun Viking and it's just a great all around spot. The rooms are spacious and clean. The facilities are well equiped - pool, whirlpool fitness room - all with a spectacular view of the beach. The staff is very friendly and pleasant. And the beach is just spectacular. This time I went for business, next time I'll take the kids and visit for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice, family resort”
Reviews.Author: coffeecupkat
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was lovely, and the view of the beach was great. Indoor pool with a waterfall was a nice touch. If I traveled back with my family, my kids would definitely love the big waterslide. A really nice place with lots of personality and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: spentas
Reviews.Content: Great place. Daytona Beach is one of the best values around. Lots to do. Close to everything - Disney, Cape Canaveral, etc. The Sun Viking had a very friendly staff. Clean room. Would definitely recommend it for any group of friends or family looking for a reasonable Florida getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Joanna D
Reviews.Content: On our way to Orlando, we had an excellent find at the Sun Viking Hotel. We had been in the car all day and the kids needed to get out of the car so when we arrived we took them out to the playground. My daughter played for a few minutes and then she and I went out to the beach. It wasnt very cold so we put our toes in for awhile and then went back and got our bathing suits on and went swimming. The hotel had a waterslide which we used and boy to my husband have fun on that my daughter even went on it. They also have a swimming pool inside that has a waterfall, but we prefered the outdoor pool better. There was even a hot tub which is great. Our rooms were considered a two room apartment. They had a bed room with two beds vanity and drawers as well as a closet and a tv. The bathroom was like any other bathroom and then there was a pull down bed in the living room next to the kitchen. The only thing that i thought was dumb was that they were going to charge you if you left any dirty dishes. But we enjoyed staying there and the view to the beach was awesome! If we go to Daytona again I will definetly stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sun Viking”
Reviews.Author: NoelleCharlotte_NC
Reviews.Content: We recently had an opportunity to stay at the Sun Viking Lodge over the Labor Day holiday. The staff were all friendly and courteous and made us feel "at home". The rooms were decorated so nicely and we just loved the fact that we had a full kitchen adjacent to the bedroom. Not only did we like the way the room was furnished but everything was really clean and it was large. We usually had breakfast in the room and lunch at the Viking Kafe which is poolside.The food was great. The kids absolutely loved the 60 Ft. waterslide.That was one of the things they looked forward to every day we were there. They alternated between using the outdoor pool and the indoor pool. We also spent time on the Beach. The beach in front of the Sun Viking is absolutely beautiful and was not crowded as the Carolina beaches are during major holidays. The room also had a private balcony and we loved sitting there watching the sun set. The staff at the Sun Viking directed us to two restaurants we especially enjoyed, the Cancun Lagoon and Inlet Harbor Restaurant. The rates were reasonable. We walked away thinking, "what a deal!!" We can't wait to go back . In fact, we wished we lived there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: Rytycatesmom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 6 times in the last few years. We love the location and the beach, but, the hotel is starting to show its age and is need of some renovations and updating. One of the windows in our room was stuck open, and when my husband tried to close it, the entire bottom part of the window fell out. He was able to fix it, but, the average person would have had trouble. The kitchen area is just run down and sad looking. The shower was a joke. It went from a nice steady stream to a trickle and back again during all of our showers. When my husband said something, he was told it was because the hotel was pretty full and most people were probably showering at the same time. We did have a problem with the bath tub draining and someone came up and fixed it right away. On a positive note, the pools are great, and the waterslide fun. I am crossing my fingers that the updating is done on this hotel before our next trip to Daytona Beach as the location and price can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “So Great I want to take up residency there!”
Reviews.Author: HanWal
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful clean family resort. So relaxing. I had minimal stress for 1 week. Would definitely return. Comfy rooms and respectful staff. The pools were very clean & perfect temperature and I cannot rave enough about the SLIDE-LOVE IT! Thanks for the free gifts upon arrival. We had fun at the beach and the weather really cooperated-BEAUTIFUL! The exercise room/sauna was nice and the hottub was refreshing. Love the privacy when we escaped to the roof top deck. The view from the balcony was great - loved watching the sun rise on the waters. The free newspapers were great also. Was disappointed that my son could not shoot hoops very well due to the area being used for parking. The snack shop access was handy.Loved the fact I could check my email even though i shouldnt have. Glad to have access to the in-room safe. Looking forward to a return visit. Thanks for a great vacation :0)

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait until next year!”
Reviews.Author: daddyschamp
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a stay at the Sun Viking Lodge and are already talking with the rest of the family about a trip back next year. The waterslide was just as advertised. The staff was friendly and the room was as expected. We stayed 5 nights and ate in four nights. The full kitchen option is the way to go, especially for families with small children. There is a winn dixie and a publix less than a mile away. Shop for the week and leave your car parked.! The gas grills are free and there are plenty to use. The hotel cafe also is a nice break if you want something prepared for you. The prices are very reasonable there. We stayed at larger resorts in the past and found the pool areas very crowded and long waits at the elevators. The Sun Viking is smaller in comparison but still plenty going on. Our kids liked the daily activities as a nice break from the beach and heat. Of course it was July so there was a T-storm almost everyday which put a damper on the day, but never lasted more than 2 hours. Many guests we talked to were frequent visitors, perhaps we will become one as well.

Reviews.Title: “Just a notch above average”
Reviews.Author: kbarr31
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, convient location. Kitchenet was included in room. Beds were not comfortable. There is a nice pool outdoors, a kiddie pool, indoor pool, cool slide for the kids. There is a nice hotel grill that serves sodas, burgers, & decent breakfast items for a good price. Front desk provided menus for local take out. We stayed in the older part of the hotel, our room had two double beds and a kitchenet. The rooms could really use an update but the particular location of room 102 is excellent, the balcony is on the lower level and lets right out to the pool so while we were traveling with younger kids that was really nice! Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Great for Family!”
Reviews.Author: garman1986
Reviews.Content: I debated booking this hotel as it had mixed reviews regarding the age and some sightings of bugs. I decided to book it based on the family oriented value that seemed to exist. There was 4 adults and 3 children on our trip. The children are 13,6 and 4 years old. We arrived late, around 10pm. The man at the front desk was polite, not too outgoing to say the least. Check in was painless. We stayed on the 6th floor in an room with an efficiency suite directly facing the ocean. Wow! What a great view! The room was satisfactorily clean. It could have used a good cleaning as there were cob webs in the floor corners, but nothing that bothered me at all. I got the privilege of sleeping on the sofa bed. It was quite comfortable. The air conditioning worked great. Thank goodness, as it was like 95deg outside. The efficiency worked out very well. Yes the room is somewhat dated but it didn't bother us. The location and pools and water slide far out weighed the room. We stayed 2 nights. Enjoyed the Ice Cream Social! One thing, we did spot 1 cockroach on the final night. Freaked my Aunt out as she hates bugs. But, we would definitely stay again! Highly recommend this Hotel for all it has to offer for the family!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Can't wait untill next year !!!”
Reviews.Author: macie1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to the Sun Viking for the past 5 years, and we have never had any complaints, or problems. The staff is always very friendly, and helpful. Rooms are very clean, fresh towels daily, very friendly housekeeping staff. Viking Kafe has excellent food, although abit pricey ( but they do have daily specials, and they are very resonalbly priced. We would not even consider staying anywhere else while in Daytona. Loooking forward to our 10 day vacation again next year.. We think it is a great place to spent your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kalii1114
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Sun Viking Lodge and had a wonderful experience. The adjoining rooms were perfect for our family (3 kids 1-5) and we loved the pools and beach. The access to both an indoor pool, outdoor pool and steps to the beach was perfect for our range of kids, and one of us could sit on the balcony watching the rest of the family play at the pool/beach during naptime. The grill/cafe by the pools was an added bonus because we were able to order quick breakfasts and lunches for the kids to take a break from the swimming. The staff was courteous and helpful in advising about local places to eat at and visit. We had such a great experience, we extended our stay for an extra day before returning to Orlando (and the staff helped us retain the same rooms for ease of use). Can't say enough positive about the Sun Viking.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, And The Management Seemed Not To Mind..”
Reviews.Author: dynasuperl0w
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for two nights upon entering the room there were two roaches crawling by the table. When I entered the bathroom there were two more, as well as a spider and it's web in the shower on the water spout. I advised the front desk of the problem I was told they would spray the room. The next day same problems roaches..when I checked out I reminded them of the problem in the room they said" this normally doesn't happen" not I apologize..I feel for the guest that were checking in behind me.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly but Needs Renovation!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jill55
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Sun Viking. I am used to staying at higher end hotels so my review reflects that. Given that information, I am perfectly happy at a 3 star as long as is it clean and updated. I also use Tripadvisor as a reference for almost every stay so I must admit I expected to be a little nicer based on its ranking. In Daytona I have stayed at the Homewood Suites Speedway which is new and I loved it but not on the beach. I also stayed at the Plaza for ($85 plus tax/night on priceline) and it was absolutely beautiful but only one pool..not heated and no other fun stuff for kids. Overall I think the Sun Viking is a great plae for kids. I think that for most reviewers the awesome kid experience outwieghs the room experience. I also think they have excellent customer service and are very friendly. They keep the hotel rooms clean and I appreciate that but at this this point it just needs a renovation. The room I stayed in was very outdated. The kitchen literally had plaid green wallpaper from the 70's. The beds, pillows, and sheets are old. The bedspread is the old polyester floral type and there is no blanket...just a white sheet and the polyester bedspread. I don't like to be critical and I really respect the good service and attentivenes that the hotel offers but if you are looking for an updated hotel, you will be dissapointed. If this hotel was renovated, it would probably be perfect for my needs but I must admit, I need a nice updated room to be completely happy even if the other amenities are great. If you don't mind what the actual room looks like then this place is great for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait 'til next year”
Reviews.Author: oysterette
Reviews.Content: Friends told me about this place. Superclean, extremely friendly, helpful staff, lots of good activities if you want to participate, or solitude if you want to be alone. Very convenient to everything. Can't wait to return next year~January AND February!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place”
Reviews.Author: Dynalowrider
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sun Viking Lodge on December 26 for one night and on January 1, 08 for one night. This was not our first stays either. We all love this place. On Dec 26 we were welcomed very nicely, but on Jan 1, I don't know who they were but they were not very friendly nor very fast on the service but I would never keep that against the Lodge.. It's a great place. The outdoor pool was really warm (really heated) and clean. We recommend this place to anyone, couples, families, long stays or just a one night thing... this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Always love the Sun Viking!”
Reviews.Author: amwdew
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Sun Viking, and we again really enjoyed it. What a great place for kids, parents, and grandparents! We were traveling with children (8 & 10) and grandparents (70 and 80) and had nice first-floor adjoining rooms -- very convenient for getting everyone in and out. The outdoor and indoor pools were nice and warm enough for a swim even on a mild but not particularly warm December night. Everything was clean. The price was also reasonable. A wonderful, slightly quirky, local gem -- a great antidote to the blandness and homogenaity of the big corporate chains.

Reviews.Title: “Everyting's Good”
Reviews.Author: Illusive333
Reviews.Content: Loved the indoor pool, hottub and prices! (You become a VIP guest after 1 stay!)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel! I'd go back, but it needs small improvements...”
Reviews.Author: transpireKy
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Daytona from Kentucky and driving over 14 hours, we go to the property we originally booked at, but had to leave due to room cleanliness. We saw this place had a waterslide and was close to where we were going to stay, so we checked it out. The guy who checked us in was willing to help us out since it was late and we were already tired from having to change hotels. We ended up with an ocean view suite. The room was clean overall, and we had a great time. Every member in my family tried the slide, from my 6 yr old daughter to my 50+ yr old mother. We all had a blast. Altough we didn't partake in any of the free activites, others did and they seemed to have had a blast. The outside of the property was very clean as well, and when I woke up each morning, I saw someone sweeping up, keeping it clean. Things I didn't like and if they were fixed would make give it a 5 star rating from me. ***Do not charge for the safes, that should be free ***I understand the key deposit, but dont like it ***The ceiling fan needed to be cleaned. It had dust on the top and when I turned it off, it looked very dirty and I felt like dust was in the air. ***Since it's a family hotel, I think the pool/slide could be open longer. ***The indoor pool's waterfall wasn't working one day, but was the next. Should stay on all the time. ***The Viking Kafe's food was good, but a little overprices. I think the lunch/breakfast specials should have came with a soda/coffee for the price, or lower the price by $1.00. Food was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: twinwolves
Reviews.Content: We got a nice room facing the ocean. I love the location. We enjoyed the pool area, slide, shuffleboard, beach, basketball, bingo and breakfast. I would suggest doing away with the grassy area and either add another pool or build a pool deck because there just aren't enough lounge chairs at the pool. The value was pretty good for the stay. The only problem we had was I came back to the room to find the housekeeper drinking our sodas. We made sure we locked up everything after that. I don't understand the charges for local calls and the safes though. Most places include both for free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: rhiannelindsay
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at the sun viking. The rooms are very comfortable and nicely decorated, the view from the balcony was fantastic. The atmosphere was always very relaxed and freindly and this is why every time we go to florida we stay at the sun viking. There are snacks you can get during the day which are tastey and the kitchens in the room provide everything you need to make your own meals. Will always return to this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “#3? Really?”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerinTX
Reviews.Content: In an effort to begin this review well, I'll start with the positives I saw during my stay at the Sun Viking Lodge (June 2007) Pros: *Kiddos seemed to really enjoy the pool and water slide. Lots of activities for kids and families *Beach is right there and easily accessible *The rooms are SUPER CLEAN...always nice to see at a beach hotel Now for the cons: *I'd classify this more of a motel than a hotel really. The room we had was very musty smelling and without a balcony, there was no way to air it out. It was also quite dated. I tried to stay out of the room as much as possible b/c it was a bit depressing. *A/C - either toooooo cold or toooooo warm...no inbetween *The fight for a beach chair begins early - forget about getting one near the pool if you get up after 9AM. And there's NO shade at any of the loungers. An attempt to move a lounger into the shade that bounces off the palm trees after 2PM is a feat of amazing strength, since the chairs on the grass are chained together in groups of four *The nickel and diming is extrodinary. Pay for the safes. Pay for an extra room key. Pay for local calls. I was very surprised by this. Overall, I'd say that as long as your expectations are not high, this is a fine place to stay. The Hyatt Regency it is not (of course I would imagine the price tag would reflect this). I will say that our room was reserved by our family members who vacation here 2x/year for the past 20 years. Honestly, given the business they've done with the Sun Viking over the years, I'd have anticipated them getting something better than the WORST two rooms at the resort. 1st floor, facing the elevator shaft and stairwell. Really? This is how you reward good customers? I'm sure that they were told where the rooms would be before booking and that the $$$rate reflected that (wouldn't know, I did not know the rate), but I'd still expect better service out of a place I loyally gave my business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family motel”
Reviews.Author: nixxon
Reviews.Content: At Sun Viking it is always a pleasure to stay. We have stayed there for many times over the years. The rooms are fully equipped with all you need, it's always nice and clean and the staff is fantasticly service minded and happy. Our kids love to ride the waterslide by the outdoor pool, and for the rainy days they have the indoor pool. With just a few steps from the indoor pool area you can enjoy a fantastic trip on the beach. Sun Viking is simply one of the best places to enjoy life in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for families”
Reviews.Author: Moderntraveller
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. Our oceanview balcony room was spacious with two double beds and a fully equipped kitchen. This is a great family hotel with lots of facilities including both indoor and outdoor pools, outdoor spa, children's play area, shuffleboard, games room and laundry room. The free internet room complete with printer was an added bonus. The staff were very friendly and helpful and even produced a mapquest map for me when I asked directions to a certain shop. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Viking a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nesodden
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sun Viking many times over the years, we keep coming back because it's a great motel. The staf are all very varm and friendly, the rooms are light and clean. Our children loves to stay there, to swim in both in - and outdoor pool. It's so nice to come back to a place where the staf recognizes you!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Anca1537
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I did not even know where to start. We arrived wayyyy to early (drove in from NY and thought it would take much longer). They told us there would be a little wait for our room to be ready. Since we were about 6 hours eary, waiting an hour and a half was no problem. We took out our bathing suits and changed in the restrooms in the breezeway and were on our ways. There was the indoor pool we saw first, it was beautiful, especially the waterfall. I took a nice swim while I waited for my french toast to be cooked; which by the way was amazing too. After breakfast we wandered to the outdoor pool, which had a waterslide. I felt like I was 5 years old again - and loved every minute of it. When we heard that our room was ready (announced at the pool) we were almost upset about going in!. The room was beautiful, very very clean and smelled like coconut tanning oil - a favorite of mine. The kitchenette came in very handy for the week we were down there; it was a nice change to be able to make some sandwiches or breakfast some days and save a little money, (new family & on a slight budget). The evenings were perfect, most kids had gone inside already and a quiet romantic walk on the beach was wonderful. Spending 30 minutes in the hot tub before bed was also a great way to unwind. In the morning everything was sprayed down, very neat and clean outside - no garbage on that part of the beach either! The hotel is literally 20 feet from the ocean - it is breathtakingly beautiful from the bedroom balcony!! I had a quiet romantic trip, and cannot wait to come back with my kids. It may not be the place for 21 year olds to meet other singles but it is perfect for mid to late 20's couples and new families, as well as established families with a lot of kids. There were plenty of kids for children to play with and even more games for the kids to play!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MichiganHarley1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sun Viking Lodge with my boyfriend during Bike Week. The room was very clean, the staff very attentive, and it was extremely quiet even though it was Bike Week . Would definately stay there again, infact next time I'm in Daytona I'm bringing my two kids; there's ton's of activities for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “Don't make this mistake!”
Reviews.Author: AsaSh
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews we decided to stay at Sun Viking Lodge. We rented a 2 room suite with a balcony and kitchen. It feels like a motel. It does have a nice slide in the pool but NOTHING ELSE! The hotel is not as bad as a BEACH! I can say that there is no beach. There are CARs!!! driving on the beach from 9 am to 7 pm. There is no sand. There are no beach chairs on the BEACh. There is no place to put them. The sand is wet and children can't even play with a sand. I was shocked when I saw it after reading all that terrific reviews. May be people spend all day long at the pool? I don't think it is worse staying at the beach front hotel if you don't plan to use the beach. But this beach was the worst I have ever seen!!!! Don't make the same mistake as we did and go to some other place in Florida. Daytona Beach is terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: nancy2vues
Reviews.Content: Just found this site as we prepare for our visit next month to the Daytona Beach area. We have been staying at the Sun Viking for well over ten years, (at least once each year). We have three daughters ranging from 12-20, and having brought friends, parents, etc., with us several times as well, I can honestly say that no one has voiced one ounce of regret about the Sun Viking. It is absolutely not for folks seeking the glitz, shows, or bar scene of Vegas, for those wanting a healthy dose of sun and sand, it is perfect! In addition to the water slide, we love the Viking Cafe and the daily activities. My daughter's friend joke that they half expect so see Patrick Swayze luking around there because the activities reminded her of the movie, Dirty Dancing. It is close to put put, go carts, and of course the Cow Licks ice cream place down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: will1969
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed her and the hotels has some ups and downs.The pros were that the hotel is children friendly.They also have an indoor and outdoor pool which helps.They also have a hot tub with a view of the ocean.The staff were very friendly and the resort was clean.All these things are positive however the resort is really outdated and needs a major renovation.When I looked and seen that it was ranked number two in Daytona it influenced my choice however most of the hotels in the area are newer and look much better.I will be returning to Daytona for the kids March break and will not be staying at the sun viking.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: ivanhoe
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge! Right on the beach. We had a beautiful view and the kitchen is well stocked. It is in serious need of updating. The walls were all scraped and the doors bashed. The exterior is not the best either. The outdoor pool is nice. We had a huge cockroach crawl across the floor at bedtime which totally grossed us out. I also had bites on my ankles from something after my stay there but no one else did so who knows? It is not within walking distance to any shopping or good restaurants. There was an awful racket from something electrical from 0500 on each morning which was annoying. The breakfast is okay but you have to pay for it. We would pick somewhere else for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the bucks!”
Reviews.Author: johncarm
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Plenty of activities for the entire family. Bingo for us & the kids, shuffleboard, basketball, "bowling", "penny-diving, for the kids. Melissa(activity director) was great. Our kids loved her (boys 11 & 13). Very good value. Staff was excellent. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, as always!!”
Reviews.Author: walk123dog
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here almost every year since I was 15, 45 now!! Now have 2 children 6 and 8, who love this place!! Talk about the waterslide and plalying Bingo all year, thought about going to Myrtle beach next year, 8 yr old begging to return to Daytona and Sun Viking. Myrtle would be a 1 day drive, Daytona 2 days down and 2 back, wasting precious vacation time! Rooms very clean, safe property, friendly staff, the pool attendents remember us from year to year, by name! Actually told us they missed us this year, always go in June, but didn't go until Aug. this yr due to kids school. Pools ALWAYS clear and clean, cafe food good, a little pricey, but sometimes just way easier then going up to room to cook! Kitchen appliances and accessories better equipped then mine at home! Love it, love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Go!”
Reviews.Author: jandy1
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay on line and expected a room with a view of the pool - instead I received a room with an entrance via the indoor pool. If I stepped 10 feet outside my room I was "in" the indoor pool which make my room smell of chlorine and was very noisy with UNSUPERVISED kids running and yelling until after 10 PM. I asked for a room change and was told there were none available. I left the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot for a family looking for a moderate priced room on the beach. The rooms were VERY clean. The view was awesome! I have 2 teenage boys and a 2 year old girl and everyone had something to do. Basketball goal was a great plus for my 13 yr old! Only problem I had was that I had to leave too soon. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Viking Lodge is the greatest!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anggsldr
Reviews.Content: Sun Viking Lodge is definitely #1. We spent 6 days/5 nights at Sun Viking and loved every minute. We were welcomed with a friendly smile and they gave a nice "welcome" gift (beach bag, cups). We were pleased with our room. We reserved a side view room but we could see the ocean when we walked out the door. Our room was cleaned, beds changed and made, fresh towels and they kept us supplied with soap & shampoo daily. One day, my purse was sitting on one of the beds and the housekeeper did not make the bed because she did not want to touch my purse. We were impressed with her professionalism. We loved the indoor & outdoor pools. Enjoyed the 60 foot waterslide. The hot tub was great too! My husband and I would go for a walk on the beach in the early morning and when we returned the staff was cleaning the pools and maintaining the grounds daily. We enjoyed the food at the Viking Kafe. We cannot say enough about the great Activity Staff...they have some great recreational activities for all ages. We played Bingo, Adverteasing, built sand castles, basketball, and coffee club (Bingo and coffee club was held daily). We would recommend this place to anyone especially families! Thanks to TripAdvisor for helping us to find this place. We plan to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “The best as usual!!”
Reviews.Author: blondiex46
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Stayed at a room with a complete kitchen. The only complaint I would have would be mold in the shower but there is mold in my shower at home. They were working on the roof of the building facing the ocean but the equipment wasn't bothersome. I have no complaints and will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Daytona :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I love this place! I'm 21 years old now and we've been coming here since I was about 6 or so... The entire place is so filled with memories, and you always make friends with a new face every year! The activities are something my family highly enjoys, and it keeps my 6 year old brother entertained! He loves to wake up in the morning roll over and go "Mommy, What kind of games do they have that I can play today?!" The staff is wonderful! We have never had a problem with anyone there... My older sister is handicapped and the staff has always went out of their way to help us out! And they remember her every year! We plan on making a trip back there this year, just thinking about it makes me want to leave today! I can't wait till after I have my baby and I can start making family memories with my children at the Sun Viking like my parents started years ago.

Reviews.Title: “my family has stayed many times im the last 15 years”
Reviews.Author: strickjr76
Reviews.Content: the sun viking lodge is the only place to stay in the daytona area we have stayed since i was 15 now 30 i stay there with my family its not new but well kept and the kafe is not a sit down resterant but nice if your coming in from the beach there are plenty of things to do in and around the lodge no its not the adams mark or the hilton but if thats what your looking for dont stay at the sun viking lodge i have staved in the high rise and the 2 story motel the highrise is my personal choice thanks to the management and staff for many wonderful years and hopefully many more i will happily return to the sun viking lodge

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Sun Viking Lodge in October of 2005, and we had a terrific time! We stayed in cottage 129. It was exceptionally clean, the cleanest hotel that we have ever stayed at ( we have travelled alot over the years!). The kitchen was exceedingly well stocked with a set of corelle dishes, and they actually supplied proper pots, pans, bakeware and utensils so that you could prepare any meal. The pool areas were lovely and very clean, and there were organized activities for families. The beach area was beautiful, and we enjoyed breakfast at the Kafe. The staff were extremely helpful, even providing pencils for the kids to do there homework when we had used ours right to the nub. It was a great family resort. We weren't impressed with the Daytona Beach area, however, our stay at the hotel made up for the lack of family fun in the region. If you have a family and are in the daytona beach area, this is the place to stay. We loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lowridermom
Reviews.Content: we just loved it, it was very clean and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families and couples too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from vacationing for a week at the Sun Viking Inn. It was terrific, despite the weather. It was just DH and I, and we were very impressed with the hotel and the employees. We both wish we'd been to a place like this when we were kids! Let me start with check-in. Because we were staying more than 3 nights, we got all kinds of freebies. What a nice surprise! We walked out of the office with our arms full. Nice touch! Our room, in the tower, was a surprise too. It obviously had not just been painted and redone, but it certainly looked it if you didn't look too close. It's obvious it's well cleaned and maintained. Usually in beachside motels/hotels, there are things I don't want to touch. I know it's the corrosion from the salt air and hard to keep up with, but it's gross. I'm used to spending a week walking careful so as not to rub against bathroom and kitchen parts. Not so at the Sun Viking. I think it's their ventilation system or the AC or both. Either way, though we were on the 7th of 8 floors and should have been dripping in humidity, we actually had bathing suits dry overnight in the bathroom! It was such a pleasant delight-- I've been to places where 3 days after wearing a suit it was still damp! I don't know where to begin with the other details. It was nice to have a place to go in the hotel where we could get breakfast or lunch. It was a good option, especially breakfast! Plenty of tables around in various places too. Really loved the indoor HEATED pool wiht the waterfall. How nice to have that option the 2 days it was rainy and windy (too windy for the beach). It is cleaned every morning, and despite what someone else said about being over-chlorinated, I didn't find that to be the case and I am very chlorine-sensitive. Someone else said the pools were small. When we were there, there were a lot of families on the 2 weekends (not during the week) and although one day the outside pool was slightly crowded, I was still able to swim around while DH enjoyed the slide over and over and over. We could have gone to the indoor pool where only one other couple were, but wanted to enjoy the sun. Btw, our first night we shared the indoor pool with another couple and at least 7 or 8 kids. I don't think any of us felt cramped, although there was a clear respect for everyone's space. Speaking of kids-- my husband and I often felt like kids in a candy store. What to do? Indoor pool? Outdoor pool? Hot tub? Ocean? Beach walk? Shuffleboard? Mini-Golf across the street? We spent one entire day in our swimsuits just running from one thing to the next at the hotel. It was great fun in between our sightseeing. We never did get our act together enough to get in on the bingo games, breezeway bowling and the other activities scheduled at the Sun Viking. We look forward to better planning next spring when we visit again. Oh, I almost forgot to mention this. I finally got my first jellyfish sting. Naturally, i couldn't remember what to use on it, so while coming up from the beach I decided to try asking the lifeguard at the outdoor pool. She handed me a spray bottle with vinegar and water in it to spray on the stings and told me if I needed more that it was right behind the counter. I did need more later (after she was gone) and had no problem getting it. I thought it was so very nice to have that handy like that. Haven't seen anything like that in all the other nice places I've stayed! In fact, the ones who have mentioned jellyfish in their information packages suggest going to the grocery store to get vinegar. I have to comment on the employees. Everyone was always so friendly and with a smile, asking the guests if they were enjoying their stay and was there anything they could do for us. It wasn't forced-- they seemed to be very happy working there and they seemed genuine in wanting to make everyone's stay a happy one. I mentioned earlier how clean the rooms were-- the grounds were too. Every morning early, there was a crew cleaning up, and someone was always around during the day seeing to things. This was completely different from my other experiences at other places. The truth of the matter is that our lovely room at the Sun Viking was about $25 more a night than the "bargain" place we'd been staying in Daytona Beach. It was completely worth it. The difference between that other place (I'll leave it nameless) with it's sometimes not working elevators, dim lights, non-working lamps in rooms, cramped bathrooms with corroded fixtures, damp rooms, indoor carpets that get wet and stay wet when it rains, one cold pool that is never cleaned the entire week, no activities, a cafe that is only open a few hours in the morning, grumpy staff, lots of noise and an overall sense of dilapidation. I LOVED having a bathroom mirror with a light overhead that didn't leave me wondering if my makeup was streaked or not. We loved having two sinks (each with its own mirror and lighting). I really just loved having everything looking clean and fresh. Oh, I can't believe I almost forgot this-- REAL DISHES AND UTENSILS! Our room had a full kitchen. The dishes were corelle (SMART move-- takes a LOT to break/chip them-- I know, they are the only dish I'll have in my house!). The utensils were not some cheap light set purchased at Kmart or worse. They were mid-weight and a pleasure to use. I'd even brought a knife with me because usually there isn't one, but Sun Viking had a very nice one in the room. And get this-- an ICE MAKER in the fridge! These little things... all week long we kept coming up with little things that did make a big difference in the enjoyment of our visit, and they were worth the $25 more per night. Add in the big things, and we felt we got quite the bargain at Sun Viking. Thanks Sun Viking! We had a great time, hated to leave (sorry for being grumpy at checkout, but we didn't want to leave!), and are already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for the second time at Sun Viking while returning my son to college in the area. We went down several days early to enjoy the beach and the sun. Last year we stayed ocean front in the large building, which was nice, but this year we stayed on the second floor of the smaller building( trying to be frugal) , we missed the balcony but the accomadations were good. The room was very clean and good size for the three of us, the fridge and microwave came in handy and the daily newspaper is nice. It is only a very short walk to the pools and oceanfront. The little oceanfront cafe is good for a quick breakfast or lunch. The staff was very pleasent and we had no complaints. It was a great deal for an oceanfront property. They have a returning guest rate that is great. Would not hesitate to stay there again, not fancy, but great for a smaller family owned property.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Sun Viking. Staff was friendly, room was great, very clean. Our 8 year old loved the slide. Quiet place, very family oriented. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Viking Lodge April 15-22. We were scheduled to arrive on the 14th, but due to some airline problems we arrived a day late. To our suprise when we checked out we were NOT charged for the first night, 4/14. It was a nice bonus expecially since the beginning of our trip was not so great. We lost a day because our flight and when we arrived at the hotel it was 60 degrees with 30mph winds. LUCKILY the Sun Viking has and INDOOR POOL which saved us. It's one of the few places to stay in Daytona with an indoor pool. Each morning the maintinece crew worked outside cleanig the grounds and making sure it was in perfect condition before their guests came out for the day. We had four kids that ranged in age from 2 - 10 and they all loved the outside pool with the slide!! We never had a problem getting chairs around the pool or property. There were plenty to go around. There is also a snack bar that is open for breakfast and lunch. The prices are very reasonable and the food is great!! I must say that the best burger I ate on the entire vacation was from the Viking Kafe. You would never know the hotel was hit by the hurricanes last year. KUDOS to the Viking maintiance crew who did an excellent job putting everything back together in time for our stay. The rooms were clean and the decor was nice. The room with the kitchenett looks larger in the picture than it actually is, but all nine of us spent the majority of our time in there and we were comfotable.
