All in All we had a great stay at the Viking and I would recommend it. Do not be turned off by the exterior. It look dated, but the rooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My kids had a great time at the Sun Viking. It was after the hurricanes had done some damage to the hotel, but they were ready for us. The kids loved the waterslides at the pool and I had a great time watching them and the ocean with all the dolphins swimming. Daytona is a great town with plenty to keep my children and me busy. The hotel staff was especially helpful with suggestions on the one day that it rained. The were great for helping us find restaurants that me my budget, too. Thank you Sun Viking! We'll be back... I hope soon!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price? Maybe not...”
Reviews.Author: JillandMegan
Reviews.Content: Construction next door completely blocks any ocean view. However, staff was accomodating to change rooms in a separate tower that does have private balconies with good ocean front, or would have checked out. Do not stay in the 2 story building. Ask for the other tower if this is important. Rooms very clean. Pool is deceptively small from looks in brochure, disappointed to say the least, however kids love the slide, although they did not open always at the time indicated in the am. Bingo junkies will like the daily games. Indoor pool too chlorinated, hard to breathe. Next time I visit I'll try to find a better value for my money. Definitely prefer this area of Daytona if you want to avoid the more hectic areas north of there. Do appreciate the hotels policy to try to prevent teenagers from taking over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible for what it is”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you have kids, if you want the ambience and friendliness of a family run inn, and if you want to re-live the kind of Florida vacation experience you probably had as a kid, this is the place for you. They don't let people under 25 check in without their parents, so you don't get that Animal House-goes-on-spring-break kind of atmosphere. My son who is now twelve and I have been four times. If you expect brand new facilities, swim up bars and dancing in the lounge at night, forget it. But if you want a wholesome beach experience, and the reassurance of an indoor and an outdoor heated pool, this is the place for you. My son has been to five star resorts in florida, the caribbean and bahamas, and given the choice he would choose the sun viking.

Reviews.Title: “2005 Spring Break Dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews before booking our weeks stay at the Sun Viking. About 95% of them were great, which leads me to believe that the owners probably wrote the reviews themselves. We were so disappointed in this hotel. The beds were very uncomfortable. We would have slept on the floor if we thought that it would have been clean enough. They pride themselves on being family oriented. Every night before going to bed I had to literally put two chairs in front of the door because I was so scared that my four year old would get up in the middle of the night and walk out of the room. The locks on the doors were not high enough to ensure the safety of all of its guests. The security was very poor. We had to call the front desk several times because of the people outside our door at 10:30 p.m. cursing, laughing, slamming doors, and bumping walls. We were told that someone would be walking around in a couple of minutes to quiet things down. This happened at least three of the five nights that we were there. The walls are very thin. You could hear the televisions of the people next door. When you look on the website or at a brochure, you see rooms that appear to be very big. Don’t let them fool you. They are very tiny. We stayed in plan #2. This was supposed to be a side view of the ocean. Ha Ha! There was no ocean view. They also have a safe in the room, if you want to pay 50 cents every time you use it, that’s great. They even charge you to make a local call. They do not have a fire extinguisher in the room. You have to share it with all of the other “suckers” that are paying $175.00 and upward a night. We were expecting great things out of this hotel and got less than mediocrity. We would not recommend this hotel at all and we will never return. I hope that this helps someone from making the same mistake that we did.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Viking since 1989”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Sun Viking for vacations since the eight story building was built in 1989. We enjoy the combination of ocean views from the top floors, the indoor and outdoor pools, exercise room, sauna and hot tub in addition to the water slide. The service is good and the employees are friendly. You won't find a better place to vacation than the Viking.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we have stayed. The first year was in one of the cottages. It was great. This year we stayed in the hotel. It was also wonderful. Nice clean room, wonderful staff, great slide and pool. I couldn't ask for anything more. This place has it all. I love the kids programs and so did the five children we had along. We will most definately be back.
